There are other combo platters and appetizers I want to try next time.
author: Maureen B.

description: Great little Vietnamese restaurant in the Richmond, low prices, solid food, laid back and cute place.
author: Spoon G.

description: Being of Vietnamese heritage,  I would say the  food is pretty mediocre, nothing  special. The vegetarian hu tieu noodles were too oily and lacked flavor. Atmosphere is casual, service is ok, but not especially friendly or welcoming.
author: Shasha F.

description: Been here a few times & I must say, it's pretty good & the portion is huge & it's cheap too! My second time here I got the bun rieu & i've never had it but a friend recommended me to try it & it was good! Also tried the bon bo hue & it's pretty
author: Erin P.

description: I love their Pho! And I love that it feels very authentic in there. The service is always friendly and their carry out is always super quick! Definitely try their imperial rolls, as well. Overall great food for a great price! And always busy but the wait is never more than 10 minutes or so.
author: Haley P.

description: Finally got to try this place last night! Definitely a good bowl of pho - not the best I've ever had, but no real complaints, either. The tendon was cut a little weird (large rectangular blobs), and the noodles initially take some separating, but the broth was satisfying, if a tad sweet. I found the small (number 6, I think) was a perfect size for me.
author: Shendi X.

description:
Appetizer
-lemon beef special:  [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/C7e1ZvLk-X3vGmZj5fuUAQ?select=4Ix-tO29ibVAX7noiAQ9pw]
$10.95 but totally worth it!  It's a plate of thinly sliced, lean raw beef on a plate with onion, mint, and lemons (although ours had limes) on top.  the meat was a little on the chewy side, especially since the slices were cut so large, but overall it was great, and didn't taste like raw meat at all.


Main Dishes
-sauteed beef with lemongrass and greenbeans:
the lemongrass flavor was really unique, and made the tender beef taste really good.  green beans were crisp and sooooo good.

-chicken curry with coconut flavor and some veggies+noodles:
yummm! i really liked this curry flavor -- very unique and totally different from any indian curry dish or chinese curry dish I've had.  there was also silver noodle in the dish which is one of my favs.
author: Liz W.

description:
Great prices for Vietnamese food in the city. My boyfriend and I walked here on a lazy Sunday,  it's right next to Purple Kow, while walking into the restaurant we were already placing imaginary orders in our heads for what we were going to get after dinner.

We ordered egg rolls for the appetizer, he ordered beef pho and I ordered a combination rice plate. Overall everything was pretty standard. I would definitely choose this spot over some other Vietnamese restaurants in the city. The pho was on point, and the rice plate was plentiful. My only complaint was that they did not offer broken rice, but that's not exactly a deal breaker. 

The egg rolls are a bit small but definitely fresh. They didn't offer a lot of veggies to go with the egg rolls, which was fine for us because my boyfriend doesn't know how to eat the egg rolls with veggies, but I could see how an authentic Vietnamese diner would have a problem with it.

Because I live so close, I will definitely be here again. But if I was closer downtown, I'd probably go somewhere else.
author: Mindy T.

description: This is a great place their Hong Kong style noodle is amazing, the owner is really friendly and the price was very reasonable, will definitely come back and recommend this place to friends.
author: Toby H.

description: The pho is so fresh here, and it's one of the better bun ruie's I've had in the city. The restaurant is super CLEAN for a pho restaurant which i really loved. Most places in the city are pretty run down and grimey so it was a nice change. It's a little far from where I am but worth the drive.
author: Angela K.

description:
Nice menu with lots of pho choices, rice plate choices, and yummy specialties. The menu also includes Bun Rieu (Tomato Crab with vermicelli) and Bun Bo Hue (Spicy Pork with vermicelli).

Portions were great. 
* Bun Rieu (4 of 5) I quite enjoyed this noodle soup. I thought it was done with a lots of flavors. 
* Bun Bo Hue (4 of 5) I also quite enjoyed this noodle soup. It had a nice lemon grass spicy taste to it.
* Combo Rice Plate-shrimp wrapped sugar cane, imperial roll, shrimp cake, bbq chicken, baked egg, bbq shrimp, shredded pork (3 of 5) Lots of choices and huge plate, but overall most of the choices were only ok tasting. The shrimp wrapped over sugar cane was a little dry. The imperial roll was a little soft in the middle, not sure what happened there. The shrimp cake was only ok. The BBQ chicken was very juicy and soft. I think this was probably the best cooked dish on the combo rice plate. The baked egg was very mellow tasting and I didn't think I liked it too much. I skipped the bbq shrimp, but the plate came with three pieces. Lastly, the shredded pork tasted ok. The dish looks impressive, but individually each piece is only so-so.
* #1 Pho (4 of 5) Not bad of pho. Really big soup bowl and medium amount of noodle. There is definitely a lot of soup. Everything was fairly tasty. I think the soup was a little sweeter than other places I have been to.

Overall, I would go back to this place. Especially on a cold rainy day when I am looking for some hot noodles to fill my tummy. I would go back and try some other dishes. They, as a restaurant, seem pretty solid with the menu choices.
author: Janice T.

description:
I visited this restaurant on the recommendation of friends.  It was a cold, windy Friday night when I was there and as soon as I walked in the first thing I noticed was other patrons enjoying huge bowls of pho.  It was the perfect night for hot noodle soup.  The waiter greeted me and we backtracked to a table in a corner nook at the front of the restaurant.  I opened the menu to discover a vast selection of noodle soups, rice plates, noodle dishes, appetizers and a la carte choices.

On both side walls there are dry erase boards with daily specials and brief descriptions written on them.  I must admit that the waiter's service was not ideal as he chose to wait on two tables who had entered the restaurant after I had entered seemingly because their faces were more familiar to him.  It would seem like he sat me in the corner so he could forget about me.  Ignored, I finally flagged down another waitress who in return gestured to the waiter and said something to him (not audible to me).  I believe it is a husband / wife team that waits on the tables.  The waiter returned to my table, apologized and asked if he could take my order.

I knew the menu pretty well by this time, and I might have been a bit grouchy too because I was hungry.  I ordered the Fried Prawn Rolls appetizer from the specials board and the Pho Bo Ko, beef stew with noodle soup.  Since I didn't get any hot tea I ordered a canned soft drink to quench my thirst.  The waiter brought a plate of pho accompaniments (bean sprouts, jalapenos, fresh basil and a piece of lime) immediately along with a canned soda and a tall glass with ice.  He even popped open the can and poured the soda for me.

The kitchen works fairly fast as food arrived a short time later starting with the Fried Prawn Rolls (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/C7e1ZvLk-X3vGmZj5fuUAQ?select=-XpjMba2tlmEYZKUGJRK6A).  These were tail-on shrimp combined with a pork and seafood paste then wrapped in layers of scallions and basil leaves and wrapped again in an egg roll wrapper and deep fried.  The result was a crispy sensation of shrimp, creamy scallion and basil.  The taste of the meat paste was kind of lost next to the basil but these were delicious nonetheless.  These came served with pickled carrots, daikon and scallions (very good) and a chili sweet and sour sauce that was more sweet than it was hot.

The Pho Bo Kho (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/C7e1ZvLk-X3vGmZj5fuUAQ?select=BozMllpEuOaeGOa9zFVucg) arrived as I was enjoying my crispy appetizers.  I love Asian beef stew and Kim Son's is very good.  The meat was simmered long and had absorbed much of the flavors of the seasonings.  The meat was extremely tender too.   There was a good assortment of meaty pieces combined with fatty pieces but no tendons.  I'm not a huge fan of the tendons anyway so this was perfect.  There were two huge pieces of soft, simmered carrot and the amount of soft rice noodles in the bottom of the bowl was very generous, and the thick, brown broth was rich and full flavored.  I even tasted some star anise in the broth.  The beef stew noodle soup was excellent.

The service started out poorly but improved quite a bit after that.  Judging by the foot traffic this is a very popular Friday night eat spot as folks were still coming in and seated after the posted closing time.  The foods I tried were delicious, and if I'm ever in this part of the City again I won't hesitate to go back.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Kim Son is such a hidden gem in the Richmond. We ordered BBQ pork vermicelli, five spice chicken rice, and pork/shrimp spring rolls to go. I'm a sucker for Vietnamese vermicelli....and oh I was so happy and impressed with my dish!!  Generous  portions of vegis and meat...the pork was so tender!!!  Noodles were cooked to perfection mixed with yummy fish sauce...I was in heaven!!  I sampled my husbands chicken and rice.  One bite after another.. before I knew it.. I had consumed 1/2 of his dinner!  The chicken was so flavorful and juicy. And the egg rolls were amazing too!  Wow I'm so going to become a regular. 
Also giving the owners a shout out.  They are kind and nice people. I was initially going to pick up my food but soon after I placed the order, my baby went into total melt down. The restaurant doesn't deliver but after learning my situation, the owners not only brought me the food, when I asked them to keep what I had given them , they said that it was too much and insisted on giving me money back. They are such great people who makes delicious food!!!!  Thank you again for feeding me :)
author: D C.

description:
BEST experience ever. The credit card machine wasn't working and it was raining outside so just as I was dreading having to go to an atm, she smiled and said I could pay later or next time. 
Amazing service and pho #7 with beef balls was the bomb. Definitely going to come back regularly! (:
author: Helen R.

description:
I seriously don't know what people would find to complain about this place.
Located in a residential part of the city, it's peaceful and relatively quiet (well, at least before the high schoolers are released from school). 
It's fairly roomy, very clean, and their food (that I've ordered) has never disappointed me. I have always left with a food coma. That's why I always bring a jacket to hide my stomach when I leave this place. 
I've only ordered their combination plates, they season everything to perfection, there's a generous amount, and it's just freaking delicious. Rice, meat, vegetables, come on people! Servers have never been assholes to me either, so that's good.
author: Stacey T.

description: I've never had bun rieu before - it's so delicious!  Ordered it with some imperial rolls to start, and it was literally the perfect (hangover) meal.  It's super easy to take out from here so you can devour it in the confines of your own home.  I'll be trying the pho next time!
author: Jenn T.

description:
The food is good & fresh. The owners are the NICEST people.Service is fast. Portions are really good sized. Prices are totally reasonable.

The chicken in the pho is nice - lots of white meat, not fatty/icky (my preference). I've had spring rolls, cold vermicelli bowls, hot rice dishes, pho... so far everything I've had is REALLY good. (Ok, they get an extra star because I think the owners are really nice & I try to go here regularly.)
author: lynn t.

description:
Some of the best Pho I've had in San Francisco that is outside of Little Saigon. If you're a vegetarian pho lover, this is definitely the place for you! They make vegetarian pho with vegetable broth instead of meat-based broth, and the tofu and vegetables they add are more plentiful than what you get with meat pho. 

I had Vietnamese coffee, spring rolls, and pho tai bo vien, and everything was perfect. The broth was delicious, the meat was perfect, and the spring rolls had mint in them which made the spring rolls especially delightful. The service here is also great, and I and my group left satisfied. 

If you're in the mood for pho and don't feel like trekking to the Tenderloin for an amazing meal, try this place. You won't be disappointed.
author: Eric L.

description:
I come here often and everything I've had here has been delicious!! Lunch and specific dinner meals come with a tofu, shredded pork, and pumpkin soup. The portions are well worth the prices. The pho is fantastic! Especially the types that are easily made vegetarian. (You can request veggie broth.)

Be sure to stop by if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Sterling D.

description: Awesome little Vietnamese place. Reasonably priced and in a great location if you live in the outer Richmond area. Decent parking available for those who have to drive. Great sauce plate family friendly. Deliciousss
author: Max G.

description:
My first reaction when walking past this place: Pho..... Kim Son? AWESOME

I've been living in Outer Richmond for almost 2 years and I come here at least once or twice a month. I've only ordered Pho here (steak with beefballs or the Special). My only recommendation is to NOT come here during the opening hours. I made that mistake with my brother a few times, in vain of trying to cure our hangovers and we regretted it each time. The Pho in the morning just isn't flavorful, is quite bland and has a soapy aftertaste.

During dinner time you should be fine. Barring the morning hours, the Pho comes in large healthy portions and the broth is savory and cures any case of frigidness due to the frequent pervasive fog in Outer Richmond.
author: Kevin C.

description: I have been there twice and both time ordered the #1 combination pho.  I felt the broth was really good and everything else about average.  Service is quick and efficient.  Yes you might have to wave at someone but not unexpected for this type of restaurant.
author: Franklin W.

description: I first went here in June 16 when I had family visiting for a couple weeks.  The food was amazing and we were welcomed very warmly.  We had never had Vietnamese food, but after walking by several times my brother in law really wanted to eat here.  We couldn't have been happier with the food and excellent service and huge portion size.  I get take out every couple weeks or so and throughly enjoy it every time.  You cannot go wrong here.  The veggie spring rolls are my absolute favorite.  It's a great experience.  I hope you give this place a try and enjoy it as much as I do.
author: Curtis A.

description:
A great Vietnamese pho places on Balboa Street right next to purple kow.  I'd say a good portion of the customers who come here grab a quick meal while they wait for the milk tea next door.  Nonetheless, this pho restaurant was quite good and the service was quick and efficient.  The broth is tasty and the beef/meat that you have is portioned nicely.  I was a little disappointed that the noodles were OK and it took me a while to stir it around and get it to not be a giant ball of noodles anymore.  Also, the condiments (bean sprouts, mint, etc.) were quite sparse compared to other places I've been too.

Like others, I was here while waiting for Purple Kow.  Not a bad place nor a bad combination!
author: Robert T.

description: Came here to grab take out on a lazy Sunday.  I love their appetizer combo.  And they gave us plenty of wrappers.  Delicious!  Their pho is a good size.  The soup was kind of bland when I first drank it, but once I put all the meat and veggies in the soup, more flavor came out.  I'd like to come here one day and eat actually eat at the restaurant.  I have a feeling their pho would taste so much better, but for their appetizer combo they get 4 stars!
author: Elena N.

description:
We have been coming here time and time again for pho, raw beef, thai iced tea, iced coffee, etc. I have to give it 5 stars for the much improved (since my first review a year or so ago), cleanliness, and top-notch service. Flavor is just right, food is super fresh, and prices are very good.

Seriously, you cannot go wrong eating here.  

--Satisfied.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: My favorite Balboa Restaurant for sure!  I have to eat on Balboa Street most days and have found that Kim Son's is not only my 'go to' but is most everyone I know's favorite place as well.  The Pho here is exceptional with finely cooked tofu,, delicious greens, succulent mushrooms and healing broth.  The atmosphere is family friendly and comfortable.  The service is quick and friendly.  I especially love the veggie pho with chicken broth and veggie fried rice.
author: Joy R.

description: The people who run this place are very, very nice. Appears to be a family operation. I ordered the Bun Bo Hue. It had the right amount of spiciness and the taste was good. The Vietnamese Ice Coffee was delicious and really hit the spot. I feel some San Jose and Oakland places are a little better but if I were in the area, I'd stop in again to enjoy another meal.
author: Frank F.

description: I love this place, it is so good! I think it is the most authentic Vietnamese restaurant in the outer Richmond district. I usually go and it's usually full or almost full, so it's that good! I usually get the combination seafood pho and the imperial rolls. It's a toss up between this place & pho garden on clement street. I like them both, they are very good!
author: Alix J.

description: Good prices, and will fill you up. Usually no wait time, service is ok. I am a sucker for viet food though so i am a bit biased.
author: J C.

description: Ok so it looks like not much, but their pho had to be one if the best I've tried in a long time. I got #7 on the menu, beef strips with mince balls. Add some fresh chili and some sprouts and you are in for a taste bud delight. The place is cheap too. $7.95 for the pho. Ambience is a bit like school cafeteria, but a nonetheless it's a good spot for a casual lunch.
author: Kylie F.

description:
Stopped by for a late late breakfast/lunch. I ordered the chicken pho while my friend tried some bbq plate. The service is super quick and the food came out in 10 minutes. 

We immediately dug in but even as I devoured my pho, I can't stop looking over my friend's tasty dish. My chicken pho was not bad as the chicken pieces were really tender and cooked just right. Their scallions were super fresh but the soup was nothing spectacular.

Next time, I am ordering my friends bbq plate. Man, it smelled good.
author: Betty S.

description:
The spicy noodle soup, Bun Bo Hue, really left me wondering what went wrong. The noodles tasted weird and the complements of meats seemed just wrong. 

Maybe the Bun Bo Hue in San Jose is just that much better. Maybe their rating is for the cooked food. 

Anyhow, if you are looking for spicy noodles, go elsewhere.
author: Tony L.

description: Came to try the bun Bo hue and it was  mehhh. The broth was not spicy at all. They didn't have pork's blood or tendon but they did give large portions. We also tried the imperial rolls which we liked. Not a place I would come back to though.
author: Michelle H.

description: If your going to have a menu with a different ethnicity on it please google on how to spell it. Hide disrespect to all cAmbodians. Not combodian its CAMBODIAN. San Francisco is pretty diverse so it shouldn't be hard for someone to proof read and correct the menu before hand. Just saying
author: Narey S.

description:
Kim Son has become my go-to pho joint in the Outer-Richmond. It took a while before my fiancé and I finally set foot into this place, as we usually would just stroll by to/from Purple Kow. But, once we did, we immediately knew we would return.

This restaurant is run by a super friendly family, members of which always will greet you at some point during or after your meal. I noticed from the way customers interacted with the owners that many are loyal regulars. 

The only thing I always get here is their Bun Rieu (Crab Tomato noodle soup). Bun rieus are one of my favorite comfort nood soups to have and Kim Son does a great job for a fantastic value. Huge chunks of egg omelets with crab pieces, chunky tomato slices, fried tofu, tasty flavorful broth, add rice noodle, fresh herbs and cabbage, THAT my friend, suits my mood on most days!

Other items I've had here include imperial rolls, fresh spring rolls, and regular beef pho.  All of which are tasty but kind of the same as other places. I do remember the pho broth is pretty good and has a good flavor.

This place offers dependable Vietnamese dishes at a good value. I like it!
author: Jing D.

description:
Best pho I've had in the bay area so far.

Come here for: affordable and satisfying pho!

What I've had: I can't recall the exact name, but I ordered pho that came with BBQ pork and shrimp on the side. SO GOOD. I also tried my friend's order of bun bo hue, also excellent.

Service: The servers were all very nice and friendly, and the food came out fast!

Wait time: We didn't have to wait long at all! If anything, we just took too long to decide what to order because everything looked so good!

Authenticity: Its seriously the best.

Price: Pretty affordable for what you get! I couldn't finish my bowl and saved it for a second meal for later.

I recommend: coming here on a cold day with an appetite and a craving for food that will warm up your body and soul :]

Hint: Visit Purple Kow next door for dessert.
author: Annalisa B.

description:
By far the best pho I have had in the city! There are so many different variations... For instance I have never seen a BBQ chicken pho at a Vietnamese restaurant before. The smokiness of the BBQ-ed meat in the soup is so comforting when it's accompanied with all the different herbs and shallots. 
 
About 8 of us went to Kim Son this past weekend, all ordered different dishes and all of walked away with the same consensus, saying it was one of the most satisfying meals we have had in a while. The guys in the group really liked their special that had shrimp past wrapped around sugar cane and different kinds of savory meats and rice. I will dream about this spot until we get the chance to go back
author: Vanessa H.

description:
I ordered the #7 which was pho with sliced beef and beef balls. 

This is what I normally order at any pho place I go to. It was okay. Not the best place I would go to when I crave pho.

I went with my family this time around. My sister and my grandma shared the chicken noodle soup. I was disappointed when they told me that there was a piece of hair in the broth! They told the waitress about the hair they found in their broth, and the lady didn't even apologize for the hair even being in there! Very rude of them. 

My mom ordered a vegetarian plate which had mushrooms, bok choy, and tofu in it and got a side order of brown rice. I would have to say, that was better than the all the orders of pho I tried.

If I visit this place again I would probably order a plate with a side of brown rice, instead of a bowl of pho.
author: Kaylie L.

description:
This is the best Pho we've found in town--and everything pho should be: a balanced, tasty broth without being overly salty. Perfectly cooked selections of beef. The portions are enormous for the price--the "large" almost embarrassing! There are also
Very interesting and tasty variations such as their beef stew pho and curry pho.
author: Anthony B.

description: One of the top 5 vietnamese noodles house ive ever been in the US their XL bowl is really XL bowl you will understabd when you see it. Great broth and excellent bbq chicken
author: Allan A.

description:
as far as pho goes, this is the best I have had in san francisco. Combo beef pho was very meaty, lots of tripe, tendon and I asked for no noodles and extra  veggies instead and was not disappointed with all the broccoli and sprouts they put in.  I got the large by accident and almost thought I could do laps in the bowl it was so big. I have at least 2 meals out a 8.95 dollar bowl of delicious pho. 

I am definitely coming back. 
and soon!
author: Nilu r.

description: Great neighborhood restaurant. The Pho was was delicious.  The service is fast and friendly.  Nice clean establishment.
author: Amanda W.

description: Ordered #1 , Imperial Roll, and viet iced coffee. Wow it was huge bowl! Big news is i could taste the msg - Sigh. Reaction in 45mins. Imperial Rolls was fresh and iced coffee on point. It was interesting that they gave me fortune cookie with my check.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Pho bowls here sure are huge! I tried #5 with fresh beef and tripe. The broth had good flavor and wasn't greasy, and my bowl was filled with a good amount of noodles and meat. I also tried their imperial rolls which included 6 fun-sized crunchy rolls, served with vermicelli noodles and pickled carrots/daikon. Definitely can't go wrong with either menu items.

Service here is friendly which is is uncommon at pho restaurants I've been to. Restaurant is actually clean and seating isn't all cramped either. Lots of metered parking and if you don't mind a short walk, you can find some residential parking, too.
author: Maya S.

description: This place was pretty packed for a Tuesday after lunch time. There was only one guy serving so I was a bit annoyed since I was on a time crunch. I thought a pho place was a fast place to grab food. I ordered the rice place and they gave me a side soup. It was a squash soup and it was a nice touch because it was like my grandmas. The rice plate was average
author: Ann C.

description: Great imperial rolls, good portions, tasty food! I liked the pork better than the meatballs. Prices are very reasonable. Maybe they could add a little more vegetables and herbs to their dishes. Efficient service and pretty friendly, too! Definitely want to try the pho next time.
author: Janette R.

description: I ordered a chicken curry noodle soup for pick up. When I got there, the food was hot, ready, and the cashier was nice and friendly. When I got it home, what a surprise! The soup itself was delicious, with lots of chicken, and they had a ton of extras, Lots of noodles, sprouts, greens, mint leaves, peppers and a slice of lemon in separate bags. This is a great place to order pick up!
author: David B.

description: I could eat their caramelized cat fish dish (#92) EVERYDAY! It takes a bit longer to cook, but WOWOW the flavor is the best. It does come bone in, so you've got to be a bit careful when eating it. Spring rolls are good too and it's great to have a Vietnamese restaurant that offers pickled jalapenos.
author: Sara D.

description: Oh the special combination platter is the best here! The portions are pretty big. We ordered one for 2 people and it was very filling. We also got the catfish and pho tai more than enough food. ^^
author: V N.

description:
Friendly service (smiling, "how are you?", "welcome!"), awesome food.  Really, is there anything else one can ask for?

Only downside is that you end up smelling like food.  But that's OK.  The food is worth it!
author: Ai S.

description:
Great place for lunch! Upon entering you are warmly greeted. The tables are already set up with menus and place settings.  Its usually not too busy during the lunch rush. Today there are  plenty of open tables. 

I ordered the special today, bbq pork with an imperial role. WOW! The food came fast and hot. The imperial role was sizable and crispy, not greasy at all. The dish came with sliced pickled cucumber and carrots on fresh romaine lettuce.  Now for the main event, the bbq pork was dressed with finely chopped green onions. Visually the plate looked really appetizing. The pork  was lean, tender and flavorful. I will be eating here again.
author: Joel Z.

description:
LA girl walkin around in the cold and rain of SF.  OF COURSE the soul wants pho, duh!!!  

Walk in here on a slow Friday post-lunch hour and enjoy the beef ball pho and cha goi chai and wrap those puppies up in lettuce.  Lotsa sriracha, lotsa hoisin, jalapenos, basil, sprouts - oh man I was happy.  

I enjoyed a nice, relaxing solo lunch watching the rain in peace and warmth.  The little owner man is OH-SO sweet.
author: Alyssa P.

description:
3.5 stars

The imperial rolls here are one of the better ones I've had in the city. It looks like they use a different wrapper than typical egg rolls/spring rolls. Hence the bonus 1/2 a star.

I ordered the BBQ pork and fish cake rice plate. The pork was tender, but there was not a lot of it. The fish cake was fried like how some places fry their shrimp cakes. It was good. It didn't have a strong seafood taste and I don't see it offered at any other restaurant. However, Pho Saigon in the Pacific East Mall in El Cerrito still offer the superior rice plates in terms of taste and value.

My gf ordered the pho ga/free range chicken noodle soup this time. She was disappointed that it wasn't whole pieces of chicken with bone. Rather it was chicken strands that tasted like they had been boiled too long. There was no way to taste if it was indeed free range chicken. All it was were a few strands here and there and a bunch of noodles. It sure wasn't worth the 7.95. For the same price, she could have ordered her usual BBQ pork and imperial roll vermicelli or even beef pho. The service was generally good except it usually takes awhile to flag someone down to get our check so we can pay and leave.
author: robin b.

description: This is one of my go to places for casual vietnamese food. Convenient for parking and no lines. I usually get pho, bun rieu, or vermicelli with imperial rolls and pork. Bun bo hue is the least favorite that i've tried here, they use some spices that i just can't get used to. I would assume this isn't the cleanest place, but it doesn't look TOO bad as well.
author: Tina S.

description: Pound for pound some of the pho is sf. Smaller portions than pho clement but the broth is something special here, the owner is usually on site and just an all around friendly human being. I highly recommend this pho and will keep chasing the dragon until I find better.
author: Nathan B.

description: I will drive miles just to come here for their pho and rice dishes. Really good price and super tasty food. They are also nice enough to accommodate any special requests with your food. I personally like to order a rice dish then add everything on it possible, i.e. fish cake, egg cake, shredded pork, imperial rolls, just gimme everything!!!
author: Katherine C.

description:
One day, my boyfriend was feigning for Vietnamese food so he decided to search for a place in the city on Yelp.  After reading all the awesome reviews about this place, the bf and I decided to try it out.  I was not impressed.  

We got an order of the thinly sliced raw beef topped with cilantro, basil, garlic and onions, a grilled pork rice dish and a bun rieu.

The beef didn't seem that fresh to me and the texture was a bit funny.  A little too soft if there is such a thing.  My rice came out before the noodles.  It's grilled pork, the steamed yellow egg thing, and shredded pork.  Shouldn't grilling the pork take a bit longer?  Nope, came out in less than 5 minutes, even before our appetizer.  Scary.  I can't speak for the bun rieu because I only had a bite, but it wasn't memorable and my bf wasn't raving about it either.  I left a bit disappointed and didn't feel very satiated.

I give it a 2 star over 1 because the mom and pop were nice but if I based it solely on food, it would be a 1 in my book.  I won't be going back to this place.
author: Elaine C.

description: This place has pretty tastey food.  I've never been disappointed here.  Their service is as good as it gets.  :)  One time they had this new dish, it was like Duck with pate inside or something and it was sooooo good.  Too bad they only had it limited time and took it off the menu.  Maybe it was either too fattening or too costly to make.  Welp if it's the cost they should just put it on the menu and let the people that want to pay for it eat it :)  At least I got to try it once :D  Their dessert is pretty good too.  My family comes here a lot for birthdays.
author: Juila L.

description:
As a resident of Outer Richmond, right near the beach, I tend to b*tch about living in the "boonies" every once in a while. However, with a new job in the horizon and an upcoming move to a part of California where Panda Express will be the only Asian food in sight, even the "boonies" are looking pretty appealing to me nowadays. So, with easy access to Asian cuisine soon to be a distant memory, I've been risking my health to gorge on as much of it as possible while it's still a viable option. Incidentally, Kim Son was the first stop in my little venture. 

I LOVE Bun Rieu and the one served up at Kim Son is no exception. If I had a Vietnamese mother/grandmother, this is what I imagine their home cooking would taste like. Hearty and full of flavor....who knew crab paste and tomato could create such a delicious medley of flavor?! I'm loving the fried tofu cubes and shrimp that's added in too. Also, make sure you come hungry because portions are outrageously large. For roughly $10, I left with a full belly and enough money to still get a boba at Purple Kow (don't know if that's actually saying much though considering it's only $3 and some change). 

They do have a $10 credit card minimum, and while it's technically illegal for any establishment to enforce one, I've never had the balls to question a minimum just yet. However, given the friendly and attentive service that Kim Son offers, I'd feel bad about choosing them as the place to start. 

My only regret is that I didn't discover this delightful spot sooner. Sucks when that happens....especially if it's at the expense of a satisfied belly.  

FOUR STARS.
author: Natasha H.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Granted, I only ever get the veggie pho, but it is consistently good, which is a great . Even though I don't live very close to the restaurant, it's well worth the trip.The restaurant waiting staff and owners are also very nice and hands off, which I appreciate.
author: Irida M.

description:
My friends told me this place had some decent food at decent price and recommended that I try their BBQ pork chop combo. So today I decided to order the combo to go. The pork chop combo came with 3 pieces of pork chop, a small imperial roll, salad, soup and a choice of white or brown rice.The pork chop was very flavorful and good. I loved it. The combo was less than $11 after tax. 
I definitely would come back to try other things.
author: Mimi K.

description: Great pho spot and great prices. I usually get bun and wow I LOVED IT!! The beef with the noodles was so tender. It's hard to find some good food in in the Balboa area so check this place out. The pho is not greasy or heavy which is so good.
author: Nadia N.

description:
UH-Mazing imperial rolls.  I get that they are pretty hard to mess up since they are just little fried delights, but the ones here are REALLY REALLY good!

You know an Asian restaurant is good when it's filled with Asian people, and in this case that was the situation.  It was packed at lunchtime with every table taken, and now I know why.

Yummy pho, tons of options and plenty of lunch time specials.  
The food also came out REALLY fast.  I felt like we ordered and then 2 minutes later the food was in front of us.

The only thing keeping it from being 5 stars was really the fact that the vegetarian fried rice didn't wow me........It was okay, and I'd eat it, but I probably wouldn't necessarily order it again, not the most flavorful that I have had......
author: Denise B.

description:
Love this place! We try to go every Tuesday for Pho (properly coined "Pho Tuesday") and this is our go-to spot. Very good food, quick and nice service and cheap prices. 

I tend to get the #4 (pho tai nam) most often; however, I've had many other dishes (such as fried rice, chicken and broccoli, other Pho dishes, etc.) and all are good. If you get a Pho dish, be sure to add the sprouts, peppers and spices (and hot sauce) that are brought to the table. They add a lot of flavor to the dish!!

If you're looking to try an appetizer, order the Imperial Rolls. They are incredibly delicious. 

As for the location/ ambience, this place is located in the outer Richmond around 36th and Geary - its a trek for some to get here but its worth it and parking is usually easy, Inside, the ambience is casual and perfect for low-key weekday meals. (Although I'm sure it's a great place for weekends too...)
author: Dan S.

description:
I've been craving a big bowl of pho for the longest time (it's noodle soup weather right now) and Kim Son was the perfect place to go.  The pho is really good and it comes in a satisfyingly large bowl. They have all the usual types of pho and they're all one size except for #1, the combo pho (it's extra large, $7.50).  The regular size is plenty to really fill you up (must be all the broth); I didn't even have room for fro-yo afterwards.

I had the regular beef pho, #2.  The broth is beefy with a lovely depth and balance of spices.  I didn't think it was overloaded with MSG, though I'm not that sensitive to MSG (Since I'm Chinese, I grew up with MSG).  All of the cuts of beef were delicious, including the very tender, silky tendon, beef balls, thin shreds of tripe, thin slices of beef, etc.  I liked adding the fresh jalapenos and their pickled jalapeno slices, along with the fresh bean sprouts and fresh basil.  

Minor flaws: The rice noodles were a little too soft and they gave me a wedge of lemon (I prefer lime).

It's not a fancy place but it feels clean.  They have a huge golden Buddha statue and family shrine.  Prices are good and they have other types of noodle soup (besides pho), vermicelli, rice plates, etc.  Love the sauce caddy they have on the side, especially those pickled jalapeno slices.

$10 credit card minimum
author: Lolia S.

description:
This is a long-time family favorite.  The beef broth is heavy and delicious on a cold day.  This is one of those rare places where you could order THE TRAIN, the pho order that is bigger than your head!  Kim Son is a great place because the variety of food that you could order and they just do so many dishes right, including:
1) Claypot catfish
2) Goi Cuon (Spring rolls)
3) Imperial rolls
4) Beef pho
5) 5 Spice chicken
6) Steamed clams

Best new experiment that deserves that .5-1 star extra is the bun thit nuong spring roll/imperial roll!  We got to test-taste.  It has the pork, cold noodles, bean sprouts, and a thin piece of imperial rolls wrapped in the regular spring roll wrapping.  Delish and genius!  

It also doesn't hurt that the owners are super friendly and attentive.
author: Steph W.

description: Came here twice, the first experience I ordered imperial rolls and spring rolls to-go. The food was great. I even came back a week later to dine in and ordered pho, imperial rolls and a thai tea. The food looked delicious and tasted good but as I was sipping on my Thai Tea, I noticed something dark, swirling in my drink. I gave it many glances and realized that it was a cockroach looking bug with wings, dead in my drink! I immediately called them over to take the drink away and they brought out a new one. There was no sense of urgency or apology from the staff though, and when she brought out the new one, I asked if I can redeem the drink for free since there was a bug. She said okay but I don't think she understood what I meant. I finished what I could of my food and asked for the bill. The Thai Tea was still on there and when asked how come I was still being charged... they said they gave me the drink with the bug for free... but still have to charge me for the new one! This made no sense to me. I was not too happy about that and explained that I shouldn't have to pay for the drink with the bug in the first place and the manager said if I don't pay then he loses money on the drinks...I didn't want to argue so gave them my credit card. And then I noticed kitchen staff from the back came out and peeked at me, probably because they knew I wasn't happy and there was a bunch of chatter behind me...that made me feel very uncomfortable. 2 minutes later the manager came and told me he voided the first transaction and I won't have to pay for the tea. Still not the greatest customer experience. I understand that bugs may end up in drinks and I was more disappointed with the customer service.
author: Tony T.

description:
We came here when we found both our usual and backup spots closed.  We were pleased to find that everything we ordered was impeccably prepared, with clear and bright flavors all around.

I was a bit concerned when the waitress advised against the crab-corn soup, but it was fine, exactly what I was expecting.

We were particularly thrilled by the fried pompano fish with ginger sauce.  This is one of those dishes that can go wrong in so many ways, but I think this was the best one I've ever had.  It was fried in very fresh oil, it wasn't greasy, the fins were perfectly crispy, and the sweet ginger sauce was just right!
author: Seth G.

description:
Pho tai: delicious, the broth is really yummy!

Mi xao hai San: really subpar...flavors were ok and noodles were just not a good texture.

Would've given it higher were it not for the mi xao, but the people were really nice!
author: Thach N.

description:
What. The. Pho. 

This is what I get from straying from the norm. I was tricked into eating here by my useless friend because he wanted  to try something new. I got the standard #1 combination pho. What i received was mediocre pho at best. The noodles were to chewy and the meat was just alright...

Everything was pretty bland. The atmosphere wasn't anything special. Nobody tried the rice plates but I'm just going to assume it's crap from everything else.

Kevin's Noodle House puts this place to shameeee.
author: Andrew A.

description: The staff are always very kind and welcoming. Food is ready FAST! Had great service with both dine in and take out. My favorite is the BBQ pork spring rolls, they're to die for! Beef pho is also amazing. By far my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in the city!
author: Morgan M.

description:
One of the best place to have pho in the city. I ordered #1 on the menu. I couldn't finish it. Noooooo!! I will just order #2 or #3 next time then. By the way, I eat quite a lot. :P

It took them around 10-15 mins to get the bowl to my table. I can easily tell that they had put a lot of effort to make the pho. It was hot and the noodles tasted really good

Tips: Clean the chopsticks and spoon with the napkin on the table to clean the dust out and ask for another napkin.
author: Ka N.

description:
Affordable, very good, comes out fast, portions are PLENTIFUL. Came on a windy afternoon after a hike so it was incredibly appetizing. Atmosphere was very authentic (not too dirty and not fancy/westernized). 

I got Pho Ga (chicken). The veggie pho is also really good and is packed with tofu and veggies. My friend got a noodle dish, it was a pile of fried noodles with veggies and sauce and it looked like the size of a football. 

Parking is easy nearby. Parking meters-hour was exactly enough. FYI, purple kow is right next door...
author: Ann P.

description:
Quite clean for a Vietnamese pho restaurant. I've been to others where the floors were sticky and the tables were questionable, and yet have great pho, but this place is nearly spotless! That's just a very inviting element that first came to mind. With that, let's talk pho!

Any pho place is judged on it's #1. Count me boring, but the #1 pho soup with all things beef is my benchmark for any Vietnamese spot! Straight off the bat, it came in a big bowl, but the pho felt less than some. It had all the necessary components to a #1, but what brought it together was the broth! Something about it tasted different. Maybe it's the MSG, or brand of MSG, or something else that I couldn't pick out. Either way, it tasted different and I thought tasted really good! 

The service was quite pleasant. I can't help but watch each individual work the tables and accommodate each guest that walked in. I even noticed how they arranged two tables to make it one, only to have the guest decided to not stay, but seeing how they did so without question or bitterness. It got busy as our meal ended and it didn't stop the efficiency of the staff. 

Simply put it: We have here a clean pho spot with decent pho and a waiting staff that keeps all these together. This would likely be my default pho if I even hang around the Outer Richmond!
author: Jeremy L.

description:
After seeing so many four star reviews for Kim Son, I was having high hopes. Maybe too high of hopes.

My boyfriend and I came here wanting some noodle soup and how can you go wrong with vietnamese noodle soups. Neither of us were craving for pho but went with the seafood egg noodle soup. It was bland...

But the other downside to this place is their spring rolls. When we got our order, the rice wrap was kinda old and dried out. It's obvious that it was wrapped probably a day or two ago...

Overall, I wasn't impressed at all...
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
I really can't say anything nicer than the previous reviews have, but I'll try!

We came here at an odd hour -- I think it was about 3.30p on a Sunday. We were the only people in the restaurant, so needless to say the service was FAST! The staff was really nice, too.

We ordered the BBQ Pork Spring Rolls (on the specials board), #4 Beef Pho, Tomato/Crab/Shrimp Noodles, and BBQ Pork Vermicelli with Imperial Roll. TASTY! Oh, and Fried Bananas for dessert. See photos.

WAY too much food for 3 people, but we finished it like champs...large, stuffed, fat champs.

And the bill came to about $36! We only drank water, which I'm sure kept the price low...but still!

I'll be back!
author: Allison P.

description:
while planning to come to visit Purple Kow, couple of us got hungry and decided to eat pho before going over to get some drinks.

We notice all the great review outside the window and decided to give this a try. 

One thing I notice that could of been better is the option to choose my size for the combination pho. I wanted that but they only had it in the large and I was not hungry enough to finish a large bowl. 

I ended up getting the beef pho and it was pretty good! I wish I would of gotten the combination pho but I did not want to waste food knowing I will not be able to finish it.
author: Calvin N.

description:
One of the best pho places in San Francisco in my opinion. Really cheap. Big portions. Really friendly staff. Love their spring rolls too! 

This is definitely my go-to-place when I'm home and desperately craving pho.
author: Karla G.

description: This place is one of my favorites cause I love how they are next to Purple Kow so that I can have an excuse to go there whenever come to Kim Son! While I come here I usually get #1 pho which has an amazing flavor while eating the soup noodles, but also having all my favorite meats in the broth!
author: Brittany L.

description:
MSG people. MSG. 

Seriously?  In this day and age??  It's in all the soup (pho) dishes and to be fair that's all I had. So, buyer beware.  That's pretty much all I have to say about this place.  

Not really any decor to mention and the ambiance feels a lot like the inside of an aquarium, if you're feeling little mermadish.
author: Anthony V.

description: A fine lunchtime alternative. Very quick service. Probably better for pho lovers.I'd probably go again
author: Henry M.

description:
Best. Bun. Rieu. EVER. $7.95 well spent.

First time I had bun rieu was here, and I keep comin' back for more.  No other place can compare. 

Unfortunately I just found out they close on Thursdays.
author: Michelle W.

description:
By far my favorite pho place in the city. Love their employees. Always very welcoming and attentive. Very clean, affordable and fast.

Really enjoy their pho dac biet, imperial rolls, pho w/ grilled pork and shrimp ( adds amazing flavor to the broth ), cafe sua da, and che ba mau. 

Highly suggest making a trip out here from anywhere in sf. Come out and enjoy the park and beach which are both really close!
author: Andy N.

description: I like this place because the staff is friendly and the place feels homey.  The Pho soup is delicious.  I've been here many times for the past 20yrs and have never been disappointed.
author: S F.

description:
Okaaay..... So I guess it's time for me to write a new review; since I haven't written awhile. Anyways, about this place, I like going here to eat because it's  convenient.  The food taste good and the customer service is too as well. Went once before, it was right after my appointment seeing someone. So today later on I'm gonna go again hehe. Except before my appointment instead, xp. 

It sure may be cost dollar extra(8 something) but the food is still tasty. I like it!!! :) ^_^
author: Lorrine L.

description:
Come and eat here quite often with friends and family. It's an easy go-to spot, that is casual, has friendly service, and good food for a good price.

Bun Bo Hue is flavorful and spicy, comes with cabbage, limes, basil, jalepeno
Beef Pho is always a good choice, and perfect with bean sprouts, lime, basil
Pork Chop rice plate is really tasty, comes with some veggies and fish sauce
Chicken rice plate is similar to pork one
Raw Beef is always fresh with lots of mint and onions
Spring Rolls are light, refreshing and made really well
Fried Egg Rolls are always over-fried and super crunchy

Always get the iced coffee and hot tea here.
author: Nancy F.

description:
At the risk of giving up this place to the masses... I will write a review of how absolutely awesome this place is.

My Aunt and Uncle turned me on to it and they, being vegetarian, although I am not, find tonnes of food they can eat.
The meat dish I have tried is the grilled pork chop meal with the egg loaf which was really good.
I order the Chicken Pho, one word....AMAZING!
I have been to most Pho houses in the San Francisco and this is the best Pho I've had in SF hands down.

Pho Ao Sen in Oakland is the only place that is better....
author: A D.

description: Their Bun Thit Nuong and Cha Gio was sooooo good, I came in starving, and I was satisfied. They give pretty big portions.
author: Stephanie C.

description: I used to come here in high school and not a lot has changed... well except for the prices. Pretty much the same menus and food available. I went with the lunch special this time as i did so many times back in HS. Food was good. Bathrooms have a terrible " old wet rag " type smell which was pretty tough to bare. Otherwise its a great place for viet cuisine in the outer rich.
author: Anthony M.

description:
I blessed with an awesome running/post-run eating buddy, Patra B. She'll run through torrential rain, wind that painfully blasts sand over your body (free apricot scrub!), and through nipple hardening, snot inducing weather.

After a particularly difficult run along Ocean Beach where it felt like Kim Jong Il was testing a new freeze death ray on us, the only thing that got us to the finish line was the thought of hot food. I told her about Kim Son, but warned: No PHO!

Patra: What? I can order Pho if I want. Pho Shizzle!

Me: You can't order a Pho-king thing unless I say! So sit down, Jennifer! 

Patra: *raises fist* What did you call me? This place better be Pho-tastic, or else you'll be eating a knuckle sandwich!

Me: Does that come with Oyster sauce?

Patra: *PUNCH*

Me: Ow, sheesh, fine... Trust me, it'll be good.

It didn't go exactly like that since Patra B's easy going, but we ended up at Kim Son, nonetheless.

Nestled in the outer Richmond, Kim Son is one of the BEST Vietnamese places in the city, hands down. It's so damn good, you don't even need to eat the Pho to get a fantastic meal, which was my challenge. Don't get me wrong, the Pho is EXCELLENT and sized huge as well.

We order Lemon Beef to start, which is completely raw, topped with lemons, onions, (the acidity "cooks" the meat) and fried sweet garlic http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/uhsxCM-63ZhDIgvZFsDcvw/l It is simply delicious, comes out quickly (minimal prep time), and healthy to boot.

Then we got my personal favorite, the special combination appetizer, which comes with prawns (sometimes), shrimp over sugarcane, grilled pork, fried egg rolls, noodles with peanuts on top, and pickled veggies and lettuce so you can make your own wrap http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/D07vcehiTpZ0fn7eCNelGw/l They also give you rice wrappers that you dip in water to soften, so you can make a roll, as well. Dunked in the cups of fish sauce they provide, and you can make as many combos as your heart desires. This is not a meal for the weak and timid and will induce food coma if eaten correctly.

So to fight the coma, we also had their drip coffee http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/e3tZIk1ppOesU4nb3NYOJQ/l . Tasty, sweet, not too heavy. 

At the end, the beef salad came out http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/GPXMqo3neqEo24n0-0DPrg/l but we were pretty damn full by then. The beef salad is shredded lettuce, carrots, and greens, sliced beef, and covered in fried garlic. They add mint for an occasional flavor explosion. After eating this, I scoff at Western salads. *Throws head back and laughs*

By the time we finished (yes, we ate it all cuz we're oinkers), I felt so good I knew I could walk up to a miniature golf course and hit the ball through the windmill. On the first try.

Yes, Kim Son makes you feel that good. And Patra? You can try the Pho now.
author: Jason C.

description: I had the chicken pho (gai), which the menu described as containing free range chicken. I presume free range but not organic. It was quite tasty and the mature wait staff were friendly and seemed genuinely nice. I was informed they use very little MSG in their food - I didn't get a headache or feel super parched afterwards, so I think that he told the truth. The place was fairly busy for a week night and I had to share a table with a couple, which then caused the waitress to give us just one bill. She happily fixed this error after being informed we were not together. Can't wait to go back.
author: Eva G.

description:
It was a sunny day in SF, so you'd think it would be a good day for a run.  So Jason C. and I headed to Ocean Beach...stepped out of the car....HOLY @#$@#$@#$!!!!!  It was freeeeezing cold and windy!  I was ready to crawl back into the car, but Jason promised he would take me somewhere good to eat after, so off we went on our grueling run.  After we got blasted by sand for 5 miles, we called it quits.

So off we went and we ended up at Kim Son.  Vietnamese food is one of my fav's!  Even though I was frozen like a popsicle, I was told I couldn't order pho.  Jason did all the ordering, so we ended up with fresh beef with lemon( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/0nDaFnotqqbMd0d0kXYBKw/l ), the special combo( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/aRHOb-aeZPvxCyEvBKFuNQ/l ), and the Vietnamese beef salad( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/GPXMqo3neqEo24n0-0DPrg/l ).

I dove right in to the fresh beef with lemon.  The slices of lime made the dish very refreshing, and the fried garlic on top made it extra yummy.  The special combo was so good.  The egg rolls were nice and crispy, but eat with caution or you'll burn your tongue...they're hot inside!  They give you the veggie platter and rice paper wraps, so it helps to balance out all the fried stuff....or that's what I tell myself.  By the time the Vietnamese beef salad came out, I was already getting full, but I had to eat it anyway.  Put food in front of me, and I'll just keep eating!!!

We had a late lunch, so they weren't too busy.  Service was very good, and the food came out fast.  The prices are good and the portions are big.  I'll have to come back to try their pho next time.
author: Patra I.

description: Came here thanks to Yelp again.  On street work duty and decided to try it out.  Friendly staff.   Good tea.  I'm on this curry chicken pho thing right now so that is what I ordered.  Prices are decent and they offer a lunch menu.  Menu has a lot of choices.  Fresh sprouts and undirty.  Not stingy on the basil.  Food came out piping hot.  Compared to Sunrise Cafe which is one of my favorite spots for curry pho, this broth was a bit more rich and greasy.  The soup did not have that much noodle and I wish it did.  They killed it with onions.  I do love onions for flavor but not in every scoop.  I was getting 2-3 onions per scoop.  Not good.  I noticed the curry pho did not have any potatoes which Sunrise does offer.  In replacement of the potatoes they provided the right amount of stewed carrots.  The protein was generous and overall the soup was good.  I would rather have excellent like Sunrise's though.
author: Chris S.

description:
This place was my first Pho experience. Reallyyyyy awesome. Started gettung crowded when i left around 4pm, i had gotten here around 3pm. I wasn't the only one eating solo so that was pretty cool. The place is smaller than it looks on Yelp but it's still really nice and they have really good Pho. Bowl was huge, i now know why Turtle Tower near by where i live has a smaller size. I didn't add any chili paste or anything to it, it wasn't that spicey but it was nicely spiced. I would reccomend this place. Wish there was alittle more crab in it mainly because it was so good. Crabballs, an egg, and fresh vegetables made it. Looks really tomatoey but it isn't which i prefered. 

I have never been to this area before but was suprised how culturally conservative alot of people were. I have alot of piercings but i havn't gotten that many stares in awhile lol ^.^

also save yourself the embaressment and order by number if you don't speak Vietnamese. I am so used to Cantonese, Korean, and Japanese dialects that my pronounciation made me look retarded lol

Got the Bun Ruei *sp* would reccomend
author: Brittainie B.

description:
GIanormous portions for pho, and good, too.  I ordered a large once, and ended up sweating and having to adjust my belt trying to finish it.  After that first time, I go with the regular sized bowls.  The pho and ingredients are pretty good.  The broth is good, especially if it just prefer brothy without any lip-smacking goodness like with stock made lots of tendons, bones, etc.  If you order a bowl with rare beef in it, you can ask for the rare beef on a sideplate for $1.  It's like pho and shabu shabu in the same visit!

Service is decent, and for the price, it's fairly good.  One gripe is they give you one napkin unless you ask for more...a practice which irks me because they have disposable paper table mats!  It can get pretty humid on a cold day (lack of ventilation, methinks?) so dress in layers as needed.  Metered parking can be busy, but if you're not lazy, there's usually free parking up and down the hill by Lafayette elementary so you can take your time.
author: Sam W.

description: Vietnamese food of average quality, at cheap prices, served by an incredibly friendly staff. Maybe we ordered the wrong things (combination plate with a huge assortment of items and a veggie imperial roll salad noodle bowl), but I'm puzzled as to why the place gets such a high yelp average.
author: Chaim G.

description: Delicious pho and spring rolls, and such gracious pleasant service.  I had #1, the owner joked that I could swim in the bowl and it was too much for me.  I asked for tripe to be held but it wasn't, I had to pick it all out.  I hate tripe.  The noodles were all clumped together in a ball at the bottom of the bowl, which tells me they weren't cooked to order.  The other bits in the bowl were delicious.  My friend had seafood pho, she loved it!  The spring rolls were fresh and tasty.  We got there a little early for lunch, by the time 1230 came the place was packed.  Definitely a place I would go back.  With 20% tip, lunch came to 30 bucks.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Local Viet place that satisfies my cravings without me driving. They gave good pho, pho ga, other noodle soups, Bun Bo hue, raw beef, fried eggs rolls and other goodies. I've had ok service. It has been up and down depending on who is working. Its also bit the cheapest or mist expensive in terms of cost.
author: Annie P.

description: This place rocks!   BBQ pork with vermicelli is incredible.. as is pho (multiple variations) and imperial rolls.  Good service.  Overall great value...
author: Dan R.

description: I tried this place because it's close to Purple Kow and was pleasantly surprised.  Ordered the bun with grilled shrimp and imperial rolls once and tried the same with grilled chicken last time.  Pretty good portion and taste.  Fresh spring rolls were also good.  Haven't tried the actual pho yet though.
author: Erick L.

description:
4 stars for great service and home cooking.  
4 stars for clean dining room and crispy imperial rolls.
4 stars for all of the right condiments on the table.
4 stars for fair portions at a fair price.
I will be back and perhaps award another star to this freshman standout of the Outer Richmond team.
author: Miss F.

description: Hit or miss with the food here. Okay customer service!
author: Whandhi V.

description: I've grown up eating pho and this is the first place where I have eaten the entire bowl! I ordered the sliced beef pho which was hot, fragrant, and tasty! I got a good amount of meat and noodles with a delicious broth. Service is quick and friendly enough. I recommend for pho lovers
author: Jaclyn N.

description: Hands down best place for pho!! Get the special combo rice plate. Crab noodle soup. For appetizers try the raw meat dish. Not to mention they have the BEST customer service.
author: Phong T.

description:
This is tied for number 1 for my favorite Vietnamese restaurants to eat in the City. 

The lunch specials are great, I usually just get the Five Spice Chicken.

If you're feeling adventurous, get the #56 appetizer (lemon beef special), it's just carpaccio with thinly sliced lemon, toasted garlic and I think vinegar. And if you find that it's a little to much for you, then just add it to your pho for extra meat! It's a win-win. Also, not too many places serve this, so definitely try it out!

The pho broth is like my favorite in the city!

I love the owners, too! They're the main reason why I keep coming back. Always friendly and inviting, I always feel like I'm eating at a friend's parent's house.

Also, the 5 spices chicken is one of the best I've ever had!

Definitely check this place out!
author: Jerald B.

description: Used to go there all the time. The owner is very nice. I've tried phos in many different places in many different cities, not one Vietnamese restaurant beats this place.
author: Evan Z.

description:
I have been here the past two Fridays at 9:30pm based on my assumption that they close at 10:00pm. After noticing that it was emptier the second time around, I asked and found out they closed at 9:00pm. However, they did not hesitate to take my order and allow me to eat while they cleaned up. I will be sure to come earlier next time. 

In my opinion, they make the best bowl of Bun Rieu, which is the tomato crab noodle soup. At most places, I usually have to eat Sriracha sauce to add more flavor...but this place has the soup down to a science. It's perfect upon arrival and is loaded with meat, tofu, shrimp and tomatoes. 

I highly recommend this restaurant. Very clean, friendly and authentic.
author: Allan M.

description: Pho Tai Gan - exactly what I needed after all the walking we did!
author: Michelle T.

description: Went here because of the 4 star rating, and was very disappointed. Ordered the #4 pho and #33 plate. The broth was bland. Find another Vietnamese spot. Oh and beware of the short server with short hair; her greetings may cause you to jump out of your seat and wish you had ear plugs!
author: california b.

description: Wow! I am Vietnamese and so I am very picky with Vietnamese food. I definitely would come back here Everytime I'm in town if I was to crave for Vietnamese food. I ordered the pho ga nuong because it was a little different for me. I never really ate grilled chicken on the side with pho but it actually tastes pretty good! Great concept! My hubby had the pho xe lua, which is the special and it's HUGE. Of course he went ham on it! I love that they had a variety of foods. Unfortunately we didn't try a lot of items because we weren't that hungry. The service was great. Very nice and friendly boss and waiter. Can't wait for next time!
author: Natalie L.

description:
A solid three stars; after speaking with Kate V. last week over her methods of reviewing restaurants/etc., I decided I would put her method to use. Basically, instead of writing a review right after the initial visit to a new place, I waited to try the place again before I could get a full grasp of the atmosphere/value/etc.

This is what I did with Kim Son; I first came here last Saturday (not so long ago, I know), mainly because I was out hunting around for wonton noodle soup per my dad's request (apparently, Taishanese people eat noodle soup on their birthday because noodles symbolize longevity/long life). I wanted to find a place in my neighborhood, and Shanghai Dumpling King was super busy/not worth the wait that day. So I walked around a little more and stumbled upon Kim Son; looked at the menu outside, and found what I was looking for. I went inside and ordered my wonton noodle soup.

First impression: well, the place was packed for a Saturday afternoon, which I wasn't too surprised about. The place appears to be family run,  with the younger members of the family being the servers on the weekends. Decoration is bare-bones/not overly fancy, but I don't think that's what they want to play up to draw in customers. Overall, the feeling I had last Saturday was that the place was very family-friendly and more concerned with catering to locals.

I received my wonton noodle soup quickly; took my time in eating it. The place emptied out relatively quickly (within a half hour or so) as people shuffled on out to enjoy the gloriously sunny day. Nothing seemed super special about the wonton noodle soup: it had wontons, it had noodles....not like I had never eaten either before.

Yesterday, i went back to Kim Son to try something a little different. I was turned off by how unfriendly the first server was to me when I entered...not sure if she found it irritating that I didn't seat myself (I didn't see a sign saying "Please Seat Yourself", plus, on Saturday I was seated by one of the other servers anyway). 

I ordered the #36 Bun Nem Nuong (BBQ meatballs with vermicelli and fish sauce); portion was HUGE as expected. They were generous with the meatballs in the dish; throughout the whole time I was there, I felt like the server wasn't too friendly to me, which turned me off a little more. Hey, I'm sorry if I'm not one of those locals who comes around often...but if you want me to become a returning customer, could you at least treat me a little better? I noticed she was fine with all the other customers, which further made me feel like I wasn't being treated fairly. Sigh.

The price of the food is average for dinner; the lunch special prices/deals seem good though, and they're in effect all week (Monday through Sunday) from 11-3. 

Overall, Kim Son is okay. I may or may not come back, depending on how I feel in testing the server's attitude towards me again.
author: Helene K.

description:
I've tried Kim Son Vietnamese Restaurant twice and have mixed feelings. 

Bun Rieu was nice and light that fired up my stomach on a cold Friday evening. Slurping up my dish, fatty here gets the food sweats and slight burn on the tongue (yes it was that delicious). You can typically nom on some bean curd cubes and find the occasional crab paste (couldn't tell if it was shrimp paste). I wished there were pieces of pigs blood/blood cubes but I guess we can't get everything we want *cries*. 

Their Pho Ga (Chicken) was mediocre tasting and the broth looked and almost tasted like beef broth. Now it could be because I was still slightly ill, and my taste buds were out of whack. The cuts of chicken were tender and the noodles were nothing to rave about being a typical vermicelli noodles. 

Overall I think this will be the go to place for Vietnamese food if you're in the area, however there are plenty of restaurants in the city that offer better food. Interior is nice and the restrooms are just toilets with the sink outside which is a convenience. Staff is really nice and welcoming, and will take the time to describe their menu for those who never really had Vietnamese food (saw it first hand with another table). I heard they don't offer the blood cubes in the Bun Bo Hue either, so I might have to resist and order some of their other items. Price is justified for their food, but it was good mediocre food if I'm in the mood for Vietnamese.
author: Casey L.

description:
Finally tried their signature dish, pho, the beef noodle soup. Unfortunately I've been spoiled by numerous good pho places in the South Bay .

The soup seemed to be watered down to cater to local taste, so its just business.

However the service was friendly and efficient.
author: vinh t.

description:
This is my go to place for Pho since it's near where I live. 
The owner is very nice and I have never had a bad experience with the waiters/tresses except for one waitress but she's gone now as far as I can tell.

I usually just get the Pho Tai, but the tomato and crab vermicelli is quite good as well.
author: Nicholas N.

description: Some dishes are better than others.  I am mad for their spring rolls, particularly the bar-b-que'd beef ones.  They might not be on the menu, but you can ask for them, and ask for peanut sauce to go with them.  I have also gotten the rice noodles with pork and imperial rolls, and the chicken salad.  Many of the other dishes look good as I see them go by, but haven't had a chance to try them yet.  I drive across town for the spring rolls!!
author: Sara A.

description:
Went here thinking I was walking into Kam's Restaurant.  Kams used to be large and took up both this store and the one next door.  I at there many years ago.   When I walked in, I was surprised it was no longer Kams Restaurant.  In fact, I just walked into the other half of what used to be Kam's Restaurant.  It's now a Vietnamese Pho restaurant.  No big deal since I was eating there with a bunch of friend.  So I ordered the "Number 1 Pho".  It's the only bowl of noodles I tend to get every time I walk into a Pho Restaurant.  And I've had my fair share of Pho #1 so I know what I'm talking about.  When I got the bowl of noodles, it consisted less noodles than all the other restaurants I've been to.  I've asked for the #1 Pho and large.  But when I got it, the bowl was the same size, the soup was the same amount, but the noodles were less.  From the get go, I've used my chopstick and spoon and was able to scoop with all the noodles in one scoop.  It was the side of about a little more than a baseball.  Not much at all. Usually when I eat the #1 Pho, I'm sull when I'm done.  This time at this restaurant, I left still hungry.  So I know they give you less noodles.  On top of that, the Pho soup didn't taste as good.  Like watered down soup.  Just not tasty like all the other Pho soup I've had.

Also, my friend had a clay pot rice bowl.  One of those rice dishes served in a clay pot because when food it cooked in a clay pot, it taste better.  You get that "rice cookie" on the bottom of the clay pot.  To our surprise, the rice dish that was in the clay pot wasn't cooked with the clay pot.  They may have served it in a clay pot with a cover and the clay pot is a little hot, but it's not cooked in it.  The rice was cooked with a rice cooker and the food was cooked in a wok, then all placed inside the clay pot to look like it was cooked in it.  Disappointment and fake. No taste again.

When we asked for out check, they give us a wrong bill.  With three people eating, I respected to pay around $30.  But when the bill came, it was $75.  WFT!  So I asked them why so high.  Turns out, they gave us the wrong bill and laughed about it.  So we got the correct bill.  What if I didn't asked about the bill and they didn't say anything after I paid the $75.  That wouldn't be good.

This was my first time eating here.  The food wasn't nasty, just not good.  The service was okay.  If the food was better and didn't skim out, I would give it a 4 star.  But for the lack of taste, the face clay pot, and lack of noodles, I'm giving it 2.
author: Jack L.

description:
The best pho I've had in or near the city (and before you say anything, yes, I've been to both Pho Clement's, that place over on 19th and Irving, the joint in Daly City by the Home Depot, and about half a dozen other places, this place still wins).

I've never had a bad meal here, the service is always fast and polite, and the dishes are reasonably priced.  

Get the bbq pork and shrimp with pho, you can thank me for it later.
author: Matt R.

description:
I use to come here all the time with my girlfriend because the pho was pretty good compared to all the other pho places in the Richmond/Sunset.  But after today, I wont be coming back here.

My girlfriend ordered the raw beef pho.  I ordered the seafood pho.  We were both super hungry and were ready to eat when our orders came out.  I put the brown sauce and sriracha my bowl and mix into the broth.  Next thing you know....a BUG floats up from the bottom of the bowl.

I immediately told the waiter and she apologized and took it back to get me another bowl.  At this point I didnt want to eat anymore.  That was pretty gross.  The manager/owner apologized to me when I paid for the bill.  The least he could do was not charge me for the pho with the bug in there.  

Nonetheless,  wont be coming back.
author: Stalone H.

description: Kim Son is the to-go place in the neighborhood. Everyone here is nice, especially the owner and his wife. Get the tomato crab paste pho bowl. It's the only place I think where it's the best.
author: Claire H.

description: Worst Bun Bo Hue I have ever eaten in my life. Edible but tastes nothing like bun bo hue. No lemon grass flavor and served with fish cake?? wtf either they got my order wrong or they just can't make bun bo hue!! So disappointed
author: A L.

description: Hungover and excited for some breakfast Com Tam. Ample portion with a slice of cha trung, bi and two grilled pork chops. Pork was dry and chewy. Disappointing. Tasted my friend's Pho- pretty bland broth and the noodles weren't even pho! What's with the chinese fortune cookies as well?
author: Anthony R.

description: Their Chicken Soup Curry is one of the best soups I've ever tasted!! It hits the spot every time. Haven't tried anything else on the menu, cos I'm totally addicted to the Chicken Soup Curry!!
author: Sahina S.

description: Have been frequenting this place for the last 10+ years. The owners are pleasant. Service is efficient with a smile. The Pho is pretty good and I have been a fan for a while.
author: John L.

description: The portions here are MASSIVE. I mean it. Do not hesitate to order one item to share between at least two people. Everything I tried here was good, especially the pho. I liked that the sprouts that came with the pho were fresh and there was a whole big pile of them. What could have been better was quicker service. My friend and I found ourselves wondering where the waiters were on several occasions. They also helped a group that came in after us before coming to us. Credit cards accepted.
author: Yolanda Y.

description: This is our favorite neighborhood place. We go here all the time. They are very sweet and it's crazy fast service. The food is amazing.
author: Jessie H.

description: I got the BBQ pork vermicelli bowl with imperial rolls. It was heavenly!  Not too heavy, insanely delicious, and totally affordable. Their lemongrass marinade for the pork was divine. Can't wait to go back!
author: Seghel Y.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend before we went to Balboa Theater to see Tower Heist. 

It was good. Love Pho, one of my favorite sou, beef Tai pho and my boyfriend had the combination special. It was a good price all together, $18, not bad with tax and tip included.    

The appearance ... well lets just say they have a storage are at the corner of the dinning room, I don't mind, but it might appeal to others.
author: Gen M.

description:
`Came here with my girlfriend before heading to the Balboa Theatre for a movie. It was like 3-4 doors down from the theatre. 

The food here is good. I had the Combination Special. Came with rice, soup, salad, choice of meat and an imperial roll for $8. Not bad of a deal and my girlfriend had the beef pho. The meat was good, and it wasn't dry or anything. Tasted pretty good. My girlfriend had no complaints for her meal. Total was about $18 with tax and tip. Not bad at all.

The ambiance though.... Well they had lots of storage piled up inside the dining area. Looked really unprofessional. but otherwise it was decent.
author: Daniel S.

description: I really like this place! Solid vietnamese food and probably one of the best in the city.
author: Steph M.

description: I like most everything I have ordered here. The service is not great. I don't know why the service is not better. It is sad because the food is pretty tasty. This is a diamond in the rough waiting for someone to help them polish it up.
author: Lesley C.

description: Delicious! Everything we ordered was wonderful. Shrimp paste  make your own spring rolls were so much fun. The pepper sauce clay pot shrimp sauce is one of the best things I've had! New favorite Vietnamese food in SF.
author: Maya G.

description: This place servers comically large bowls of Pho and its amazing.  The pho was so flavorful and they gave a generous helping of meat which I loved.  Best hidden gem for pho.
author: Emily K.

description: It has been our family's favorite place since 2005! Great service and the best Pho you can find around!
author: Igor K.

description: Pho is very good here. Friendly service. Cantonese speaking. Credit cards accepted!
author: Wilson T.

description: The greeting was comfortable, the guy running the place seemed genuinely very nice.  The lady who brought the takeout bag seemed to be having a slightly grumpy day, as if more used to dealing with kitchen staff than customers.  I had the raw beef salad, imperial rolls and roasted pork over vermicelli, super yum.  It would have seemed nitpicky to deduct one star just because the raw beef salad was juuuust a bit less tasty than at my much-mourned Tay Giang (now closed) so I thought I'd say it in the comments.  Anyway, I now have a new favorite for my Vietnamese fix.
author: GreatAlfredini J.
