description: #easy #glutenfree love the BBQ pork spiring rolls and their noodle soups.  Some days nothing beats a great bowl of noodles.
author: Heather S.

description: This was my middle son's favorite place to eat when he was in elementary school.  Flavorful broth, decent rice plates, and friendly service.
author: JJAMZ C.

description: The most thoughtful vegetarian pho I've come across. It has an interesting mix of ingredients and even a veggie broth option for vegans. You can bring your vegan gluten free friends here! The decor is pleasant and the feng shui is not wack. The staff is always nice. Comfortable vibe. Love it.
author: Orlando A.

description: Silverware and glasses were dirty and had chunks of food still on them and the table was sticky.  Totally willing to overlook this, but then i started eating (pretty decent) and found a long black hair in my pho. My hair is brown. Sort of lost my appetite.  Unsanitary!
author: Chelsea D.

description: Best pho in town ! portions are great prices are great location is great! THIS PLACE IS GOOD!
author: Jorlyn W.

description: Came here a few times and now realize that the food is just so lacking even to the place that is up the block. This place is cash only, often smells of smoke from the kitchen and isn't that clean, even compared to other places.
author: M C.

description: Pho. Excellent, not too many pho shops in SF do it better. The imperial rolls were great also. Vietnamese coffee was probably the best I've ever had, although it did keep me up that night!
author: James P.

description: Every time I go to the Balboa Theater, I eat at this restaurant first.   Great food, and a nice selection of vegetarian dishes.    At peak time, there can be a line, so go early.   It can be a little noisy when the restaurant is full, but the overall atmosphere is warm and friendly.
author: Roger B.

description: Do you like pho?  I do!  If you do too, you will like Kim Son. Start with a delicious Bánh xèo, then a tasty pho noodle soup, and then have one of they many other Vietnamese dishes on the menu that is absence from most pho-restaurants. Bon Appétit!
author: K J.

description:
I use to live a few blocks from this place and go often by myself.  

Bo Tai Chahn is great!!  I always come back just for this dish.  Their Pho's broth is not overwhelmingly salty but has a sweet taste to it as well.  I order these two items every time and it never went wrong.

I'm a fan!!
author: Patrick C.

description: Decided to give this local restaurant a second chance. This time around the service was good! Quick and friendly even with the kid! The pho noodle even tasted better and more plentiful than our initial visit. I'm glad we gave this place another try because its very close to home and that's a huge plus!
author: c h.

description:
Typical pho place.

They have good food though.  I've always ordered take-out from here, and I'm never disappointed.  Good quality, but not very large portions.  Yes, there are better places in the city, but if you're hungry and need something in a pinch, this is a safe place to get it. 

The owners are so nice, friendly and eager to please too!

They are pretty quick about serving you, whether it's sit-down or take-out.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Came here after miki was closed. The restaurant was quite clean and the waitress was prompt and courteous. I got the combination pho (#1) and my friend got the curry chicken noodle soup. The broth was pretty good and tasty as I barely tasted any MSG although the soup was kinda oily. The noodles however were clumped together and was kinda hard. They charge and extra dollar to have the beef on the side so that is a inconvenience. The tendons, tripe, and meatballs were standard. For dessert they did serve each of us a piece of cantaloupe so that was a plus.

The bill came out to be $20 after tax and tip which is normal for 2 bowls of extra large pho. I probably would try some other restaurant next time as nothing really stood out besides the cantaloupe.
author: Robert Y.

description:
Coming from South Philly's Vietnamese Pho of multiple varieties, you know I'm already all snobby and think I'm a know it all about Pho. 

We ordered the summer rolls for appetizers, it's a little smaller than the ones I get on the east coast (probably because they don't stuff the whole thing with vermicelli to make it look big and "appetizing"). The "prawns" were definitely fresh.

We ordered the free range chicken Pho and the free range chicken was soooooooo good, noodles were plentiful, soup base was flavorful. It's like you keep diggin' in with your chopsticks to keep findin' more chicken, and more noodles. I was a little disappointed to not find any beef brisket on the Pho menu though.

The lady that works there was carrying hot as* Pho bowls like it's no other. Represent!

If I come back again I'd def want to try out the rest of the menu, they got a pretty good selection!
author: Doriancita X.

description:
Best Vegetarian Pho and Best Vegetarian Spring Rolls!!!!

I *heart* Kim Son because they make veggie pho with veggie broth. It is delicious with a variety of vegetables and just the right amount of noodles. The spring rolls are especially tasty and the filling is warm and perfectly seasoned. The place is clean and service is friendly. Additional star for the hot tea while I wait for my to-go orders.

Thank you for the fairly priced food which gives me an option to eat out!
author: O O.

description: Lots of variety. It's not bad and it's clean enough for an Azn place. For something quick and good prices, this place will do.
author: Karen H.

description:
I came here expecting good food (based on my aunt's hype) and left quite disappointed.

My cousin had his graduation dinner here tonight, and tables were reserved ahead of time. You'd think that would give you some sort of guarantee for good cooking, but it didn't. All the dishes were probably pre-cooked and delayed because guests were arriving late from out-of-town, but that's still no excuse.

We had about 10 dishes, and all of them were average at best and mediocre at worst. The fried calamari (muc chien don) appetizer had a lot of batter and lacked the substantial chewiness of good squid. The clay pot catfish (ca kho to) was pretty good, but anything that's so sweet has to be. The salt & pepper prawns (tom rang muoi) were not plump and flavored with a too-sweet sauce (perhaps the wrong dish even). Most of all, the salt & pepper crab (cua rang muoi) was thoroughly disappointing - lacking in breadth and dry. I suppose that the barbecued beef (bo nuong) was good, based on table commentary, but I didn't actually have any since everyone else snatched it up.

I did leave full, and I guess the service was alright, but the food (none of which was pho, by the way) just seems to be prepared poorly and from low-quality ingredients. I've eaten at much better restaurants that serve traditional Vietnamese dishes than this one.
author: Chris V.

description:
My close friends Judith and Jack and I go here whenever they are in town we LOVE it!
The owner knows our faces and always gives us a little extra;)
The service when he is there is amazing, its not bad when he's not there its just better when he is. One thing I love about this place is that it is kind of a secret, we can always find a table when we go there Friday night at prime dinner time.
Judith always gets the vegetarian fresh rolls, we always ask for the sweet and spicy chili sauce ( you have to request it its not on the menu). She was the one who prompted me to write this review, she truly looks forward to visiting me and coming to eat here. She says best vegetarian rolls in the city...they truly are scrumdilyish!
I always get their Pho...One word, AMAZING! It is a big bowl of the best noodles with free range organic chicken which is always tender and good. Jack always gets the vegetarian chow fun noodles, he loves it.
This is a great place and they are always so accommodating. It is always cheap but the quality is good.
Don't tell too many people though, its a secret;)
author: cleolvr D.

description: The pho here is not bad and there is only one size. The other menu items are ok too but nothing too spectacular.  We come here for pho then to purple kow after =)
author: Jennie W.

description:
Yelpers I have been deceived by all the rave reviews for this place! It was CRUDDY weather today, which made it a perfect noodle soup day. The bf and I decided to venture out to this place, and away from our usual outing at Pho Clement 2 on Geary (PC2, forgive us for cheating on you!) based on all the good reviews. 

We tried the BBQ spring rolls first. These were meh, pork was totally dry with no taste and could not be saved by whatever sauce it came with, nor being doused in soy sauce.

I ordered the curry chicken flat rice noodle soup and was thoroughly disappointed by first sight, first, second, third taste and was actually completely disgusted by it halfway through. My first thought was how oily it looked, gobs of bright red spots of oil drops splattered with the yellow curry broth and how I had to search for my noodle cause there hardly was any. But in the end, the amount was fine because because I could only eat half before I felt like I might hurl it back up. 

The bf ordered the spicy noodle soup with beef and something else and it totally lacked flavor. He was not super thrilled about it either.

Just as we were getting ready to pay out the bill, my stomach got attacked by oober cramps and wouldn't stop till we got home. Even my tummy thought it was crap!!

We left still a little hungry, and thought about going back to PC2 just to cleanse ourselves of the icky pho we had, and perhaps beg for forgiveness for daring to stray from them.
author: Pauline T.

description:
Best Pho and Spring Rolls I have experienced in the City, thus far.  For pretty cheap.

I had the Chicken Pho, and on the menu, this venue claims the chicken meat comes from "free-range" chicken (I hope this is true). The chicken meat was white, some-what shredded, and the soup was full of that chicken broth flavor I love with good chicken pho.  I highly recommend it.

I also had the spring rolls, and Kim Son provides 4 lengthy spring rolls that look as if they have been freshly prepared.  Very tasty and healthy.  I also recommend this starter.  I have been looking for good pho in the CIty for awhile, and I am so glad that I found this place.

Parking is somewhat plentiful, since you are in the Richmond.  Overall, a nice Vietnamese restaurant that provides quality food for cheap.  A universal winning formula.
author: M P.

description: Pretty good pho and good service! Always seem to be packed so thats a good sign. Must try if your in richmond!
author: Hubert H.

description: Really liked this place.  Has a warm, friendly feeling to it.   Services was friendly and there were lots of vegetarian choices on the menu.  All the food was hot and tasty.   This place can be very busy on the weekend, so allow time for that if you go
author: Axa M.

description: Grabbed take out the other day for lunch, fresh rolls and tofu chow foon--ordering/pick up was quick and easy and the staff were nice. The food was a hot mess, overly saucy, limp veggies and flavorless. The fresh rolls were stuffed with cooked ingredients you would expect to find in spring rolls. Fail.
author: Cec D.

description: Pretty much my go to for pho.  Good portions, price, and the servers are actually friendly.
author: Kelvin S.

description:
Really big portions.  Ordering a "small" bowl is more than enough.

All I ever get is the Pho here (been here 2x now) and I've been pleased.  Although the second time I went here, I forgot that I had been here b/f.  

Pho noodles are cooked properly, broth is not too too salty.  A little oily true, but this is authentic, hole-in-the-wall PHO people!  The soup comes with all sorts of non-identifiable bits of beef - tendon, tripe, fatty tendon, thinly sliced beef....  It is for realz!  (In case you didn't realize, I happen to PREFER pho where I couldn't tell you what everything in the soup is...)  Very satisfying and hearty.

I also tried the spring rolls once (you can order half portions if you want).  I wasn't all that impressed.  The protein portions in here are pretty minimal, but the sauce is good.

Negatives:  Lemon instead of lime....  I want lime with my pho, not lemon...  Ooo - also, cash only unless your bill is over $10
author: Stephanie P.

description: I always order #32 emperial rolls with BBQ pork on a bed of vermicelli noodles and veggies. The amount is pretty decent with enough for leftovers.  MSG could be in every dish I didn't ask this time.
author: Priscilla K.

description:
Kim Son is one of the nicest and most pleasant Vietnamese restaurants I've been to. The owners became very familiar with our orders and always said hi and talked to us whenever we came in to eat. The food is always consistent and fresh and with generous portions. My favorites to eat here are the spring rolls with BBQ pork (usually on the specials board) and the chicken salad-a HUGE portion of fresh salad with fish sauce. I'm working up an appetite just thinking about it. Trying something new on the menu also guarantees satisfaction and there hasn't been a disappointing meal yet. 

Nothing pretentious and always fast service that pho restaurants are notorious for. Top it off with the fact that it's less than a 5 minute drive (or a 10 minute walk) from our place and Kim Son is one of the top 5 Vietnamese restaurants I've been to in the city or San Jose.
author: Emiko T.

description: Great bún riêu & BBQ chicken pho. Fresh basil and bean sprouts and cabbage. Try imperial rolls.
author: Rose M.

description:
REALLY great place. I decided to try a different place, since Pho ho hiep has gotten to be so crowded and expensive. We found this place, which is incidentally not very far from that other restaurant.

Overall I really like this place a lot. We came around lunch time, and by the time that we got our food, the place was completely packed. We each ordered a pho, the beef and the chicken. I had the small size. They offer small, medium and large bowls.
author: James M.

description: Had the claypot that was pretty good but the Vermicelli bowl was and will be what I will be coming here for. Haven't tried the Pho, but have high hopes.
author: Vicki T.

description:
Delicious ass pho, delicious ass vermicilli plates, good ass service, great location, quick, and clean restaurant. The little man statue at the counter that says "welcome" looks exactly like the owner of Kim son, short, attentive, and full of friendly. I find it quite ridiculous that he has made a 4 feet replica of himself and placed it prominently atop the store counter. I also think he is awesome for doing so. The only draw back to this otherwise good restaurant would be the Balboa street parking, which is freakin insane due to every family in the richmond district to have like 9 cars per 4-person household. ridiculous. Other than that, this place is a great place to have breakfast, lunch, dinner, or all 3! I would compare this place's great quality to that of Kevin's Noodle House.. except with slightly better parking on weekends despite the already difficult status of Balboa parking.

-wifive-
author: simon k.

description: Came here for dinner with a friend. It was a cold day and pho sounded really good at the moment. Pho here is okay, nothing special or something I would go out of my way for. My friend got a stir fry tofu dish which was pretty good... flavor and everything was there and it wasn't too spicy. Decent food and the service here is pretty fast.
author: Johnson S.

description:
one extra star for cleanliness.

we went clubbing the night before and of course, what's the best cure for drinking?? pho. we were going to head to Loi's on irving, but parking was a bizzznatch. so we gave up and came here. i've been here before when i was younger and there was a nice old man who worked there and i think speaks my language. 

place wasn't crowded and we sat and ordered right away. too bad they didn't give tea on the house?

ordered the #2 pho and bf ordered the lunch combo plate. and some spring rolls.

the spring rolls were okay, the meat kind of dry, but sauce was good.

bf's combo came with soup, corn soup mmm reminded me of my mom's. he ate his whole plate and didn't offer me any! so i guess it was good, not a bad deal for almost $9.

my pho was good, but since my stomach was a lil funky from drinking, not sure if the meat tasted funny or my taste buds were off...but i ate half or so and bf finished it off too.

we were both really full, decent prices, parking was a little hard to find, and this place iss a bit farther but if we run out of spots to go, we'll come here again.
author: Christine M.

description:
Great food!  We ordered the spring roll app, a seafood &  crispy noodles main dish and a meatball main dish.  All three were delicious.  The spring rolls came with a super yummy peanut sauce.  Plus two drinks, our total bill was $28 - not bad!

While the wait staff was a little slow at times, we weren't in a hurry and could have easily gotten their attention if we tried harder. 

I'm going back to Kim Son Vietnamese sooon!  Maybe tonight...?
author: Kalah A.

description:
A great find especially when it's so close to other restaurants similar to it on Clement and Geary.

Favorite dish to order is the vermicelli with grilled pork and shrimp. Mmmm..can't help thinking about it. The noodles aren't warm but cooled and it's chewy in texture. The carrots and radish relish is grated evenly in size. THe fish sauce mixture is not on the salty side I would say it tastes more sweet.

Restaurant looks clean and service is friendly. 

Cool thing to try is the salty lemon drink. You'd be surprised!
author: Donna C.

description:
Lovely place. Nice and clean, orderly. Service attentive and delivered with a smile. Not so jam packed that it's elbow to elbow but good enough.

I ordered the pho #1. Large bowl, filling. Excellent broth with right balance of noodles to protein ratio. Excellent pho, rivalling that of Yummy Yummy on Irving, mebbe even surpassing it, it was that good. 

Like it here so much my gf and I have made it regular status place. 

And they even take credit cards! That is super rare for a city of mom and pop restaurants that like to cheat on taxes by having cash only businesses.
author: Bill N.

description: My new favorite DIY rice paper food wrapping restaurant.
author: Forest S.

description:
I always seem to go here for a quick bite before heading to the Balboa Theater (what happened to their double features? i miss those.). Nothing fancy, but gets the job done.

Very friendly service and tasty food. The pho is solid (I've had both the chicken (Pho Ga) and the combo (Pho Dac Biet)) as are the rice plates and bun (I get it with the grilled pork and imperial rolls). I tried the Bun Rieu once and it was decent. Not the best thing on their menu, I'd say, but above average if you're jonesing for that.

Solid Vietnamese in the outer avenues. Did I mention the wait-staff is very attentive and friendly? :)
author: Andrew C.

description: Pretty good pho for the price. I really had no huge dislikes. I liked my dish and the customer service. Only thing I would probably say is to give more noodles. Besides that, it isn't a bad place to come to.
author: Sonlay V.

description: This place has such good pho! I come here all the time and get their seafood pho, and I'm always happy with it. If you want pho (I haven't really investigated the rest of their items) go here.
author: Stefani O.

description:
If you have any health issues, stay clear.

The salt in the pho will pay for a quick ride to the emergency room.  Wow!  It was so 'haum', I wanted to order a cup of hot water.  Not to drink, but to dilute the thing!

We walked in with high expectations.  Nice and open seating.  Clean, friendly, menu's were modern.  Yelp reviews were legit too.

But alas, I knew we were in trouble when our '5 spiced chicken over rice' came out literally 2 minutes after we ordered it.  Hey, we know you re-heat it, but damn, lie to us.  This too, was pretty salty.  Flavor was there - but definitely just a quick soak and a basting on the stove.  Nothing to write home to mom about.

The large pho, however, was large.  I mean, Man Vs Food large.  So, maybe it was an off night.  It was Monday night, so I could of gotten leftovers.

Nonetheless, I'm cool off this place.  It's not bad, but it's not great.
author: Isaac L.

description: Ok, I'm eating my words from my original review. Like I mentioned, I was genuinely surprised that this place had such good reviews. Since the last time I dined here, two of my friends have told me that it's their favorite pho restaurant in the city and were shocked that I didn't like it. I decided to give it another try and came here again with my bf. I ordered the bun rieu at the suggestion of Patricia K. and my bf ordered a spicy beef noodle soup (forgot what it was called). This was actually the first time I've ever had bun rieu... at pho restaurants I usually just order pho or vermicelli noodles. I guess I'm not very adventurous. Anyway, the bun rieu was one of the best noodle soups I've had in a while, and it really hit the spot on a gloomy evening. The tomato-y broth felt comforting, and the crab meat paste was delicious. After I tried my bf's broth mine tasted bland in comparison, since his was so spicy. Honestly either way you can't go wrong with the broth. I still don't feel like the pho was that amazing, but according to some Vietnamese friends of mine it's some of the best in the city, so maybe my taste is unrefined? Either way, this experience shows me that I should branch out and try more entrees at Vietnamese restaurants.
author: Jacqueline K.

description: I love their bun rieu!! The restaurant always has a good amount of people inside but I've never had to wait for a table.  Good service and bombass bun rieu :)
author: Mimi N.

description:
I used to visit this restaurant every once in awhile when i was young, great place for family gathering as they're usually not overly busy/crowded. It's been years since I've been back and decided to try it out again.
I came here on a sunday, no wait, ordered a different dish instead of the 5/7items rice plate (by the way is good as i usually order that dish). I decided to order bun bo hue (BBH) as i was craving it. Also got the 3 color drink and raw beef salad. The 3 color drink was just ok, not enough goodies or ingredients inside, still ok though. The raw beef salad did not look appealing, the beef looked really pale, lots of lemon slices to try to beautify the dish but the taste was just ok too, mediocre. There was ample of onion and garlic though. The noodle dish (BBH) i ordered also didnt look appealing, does not look like a typical BBH dish, does not smell spicy at all. After i taste test it, i was deeply disappointed. Flavor was bland, watery and very differ from the BBH im used to eating. I even added a lot of peppers to try to increase the flavor, but in the end, I'm still left unsatisfied.
Overall i will only order the rice plates, dont order the bun bo hue!
author: Hao B.

description: Average prices.  Decent portion sizes.  Tastes pretty good.
author: Javier G.

description: This has become one of my favorite restaurants in the area. I've skipped the meat pho since it's not my thing. So what do I order here? Mostly vegetarian. I love their veggie spring rolls, their veggie pho (I get mine with egg noodles instead), and their vegetarian chow fun. Why the five stars now? Because they know how to serve vegetarians (not that I am one), but I try to make it my daily goal to eat as many vegetables as I possibly can. And honestly, this place serves you a LOT of vegetables on your plate / bowl. This is the main reason why I have come to love this place. Many restaurants don't do that. They don't fill up your plate with vegetables. Some places fill it up with so much rice / noodles, and just a few pieces of vegetables. Well, don't worry about this place being a cheapskate with veggies; they will (trust me) serve you right.
author: Liz V.

description:
I love this place for it's proximity to my apartment, not many vietnamese restaurants in my part of the outer richmond.

I usually get an order of noodle soup (pho, bun bo hue, bun rieu) with a side of spring rolls and che ba mau for dessert. the spring rolls are pretty darn good, i prefer home-made ones but these hit the spot fine. their che ba mau is really good as well (three-color dessert).

i've been here or gotten to-go about 10 times..the bun bo hue is consistently bland, unfortunately. bun rieu is decent, they put crab entrails in the soup and add fish cake, it would be better with periwinkle, however. the pho is nothing special, but not bad either. i've had their bun thit nuong (dry rice noodles with grilled pork) once to-go, and i really enjoyed it.

overall: the serving size is a little on the small side. the service is timely and very courteous. sweet people at this mom and pop (and daughter/niece) shop. will keep coming back here for the convenience and proximity, and because i always get what i expect, no surprises, good or bad.
author: Tuyen K.

description:
First off, my mother-in-law has been searching for this one particular noodle soup that she had in Vietnam 50+ years ago. Every time we eat somewhere even vaguely asian this soup comes up.
Well, she found it. And she was so happy that for this reason alone Kim Son gets 5 stars. BUT- the food was also really really good. M-I-L had seafood pho with egg noodles (just like the ladies in the village used to make) and I had vegetable chow fun. I LOVE chow fun and this did not disappoint.  Lots of veggies and tofu, lots of noodles with just that smidgen of grilled flavor present, and just the right amount of seasoning.
All this for just under $20.
I very much enjoyed this place and will be returning on my next trip to the city. 
Also, the place was clean and the staff was very friendly even though we wandered in around 2:30 and the other customers there were just finishing up their lunch.
author: Karen C.

description:
LOVE IT. Came here on Friday Night, party of 4.

Eats: Appetizer spring roll dish where you make your own--THE BEST! I love it and now I know how to make spring rolls!! 

Pho-YUM, delicious broth and very large portions! 

Special Combo Rice Plat-YUM, flavorful, lots of food and delishhhcious! 

Staff is extremely friendly and parking isnt too bad. 

I heart vietnamese food. chowpchowpchowp!
author: Amy S.

description: I have been here many times and let's say that this place isn't that bad!!  The staff here are very friendly which I like, but the pho isn't very good honestly.  =/... Pho on Clement down the street is so much better, but what this restaurant makes up for this is their spicy lemon grass bean curd and string beans dish.  I absolutely love this dish and I order it every time I go here now with friends.  I'm a pescatarian, but I do eat meat three times a week, so going out constantly with friends leaves me down to not many options (especially a pho place) for a meat-free dish.  This dish was delicious I think it's 53?  I'm not sure which number it was, but it was on the veggie side and it's super tasty.  The lemongrass is in your face and WHEW I would go to this place just for that dish.  ^^
author: John H.

description: definitely coming back! got the seafood pho, and it was a good size with lots of different seafood additions, even including two large clams! broth was yummy and i liked how the noodles weren't overcooked. service is pretty fast. can't wait to come back and try other things.
author: Sabrina L.

description: This place has good Pho, its just the way I remember my first experience. Big portions and that special Pho taste that is hard to match. What even better is the parking, that is rare in SF.
author: Steve N.

description:
I noticed business has picked up here the last couple of times to where we actually needed to make a reservation for one of the big tables.  Great news for such a good neighborhood restaurant in this economy.

The food's still consistently great.  We always get the bbq pork plate with the rice paper wrappers that you roll yourself.  The wrappers are brought out dried/hard and you dip them into a bowl of steaming hot water to soften and use as a wrapper for the pork and veggies.  It comes with fish sauce but ask for a side of peanut sauce too -- so good.  The bbq chicken is also some of the best around -- super tender and juicy.
author: Jeannie C.

description:
OMG! Their picture for pho tai has meat on da side :)

Happy noodle dance commence. Pan flutes and pi paw activate! Belly swishing, full of broth, wrapped in oodles of noodles!

So....totally yummy! The imperial rolls were excellent! Missing mint and lettuce to wrap, but i bet they woulda given it to me if i had asked...and knew how to say it in vietnamese.

Siooooooo much beef on the side! It was a plate that was just jam packed with it!

The broth was tasty, the noodles good. The rolls were the real highlight here!
author: H B.

description: Kim Son's Vietnamese pho tai and bom bo hue are to die for! The staff is comprised of a bunch of sweethearts, and best of all, this place is cheap!
author: Matt T.

description: ORDER THE CRAB TOMATO NOODLE SOUP RIGHT NOW. It's not fancy, but it IS five stars. I've eaten here a million times and always get the beef ball pho or the crispy noodle stir fry, but tonight i tried the tomato crab shrimp noodle soup and OH MY GOD IT IS AMAZING. I want five more bowls, please.
author: Susanne A.

description: I've only been here two or three times but this place seems to always be packed. I remember I used to study across the street at Zephyr's and never really saw how many people went into this restaurant until I walked in one day  for dinner. The pho is big and fulfilling but the service is sometimes a hit and miss, depending on how busy they are. All in all, it's not a bad pho restaurant in the outer Richmond district.
author: Edgar G.

description:
I'm one of those people who whenever I am at a Vietnamese restaurant, I know what I want. Doesn't matter if it's a new or familiar restaurant...I get the popular #1...And that is what I did at Kim Son.

My favorite part about Kim Son is the amount of beef tripe they give you. I love beef tripe, so the more the merrier. I tend to be disappointed whenever I received a bowl with 2 pieces of tripe and I will save it for last...because I like to save the best for last  ;-)
My eyes lit up when I stared at my bowl and noticed a handful of tripe swimming in the rich soup....THANK YOU!! BEEF TRIPE!!

I came here to treat my mom out for lunch and she ordered the #5...she said the soup was a bit salty for her taste...but I thought it was perfect.

I like it spicy so I went to town with the hot sauce...maybe that's why I wasn't complaining...because my taste buds were numb from the spices. 

Overall, a nice place to go to....good price...roomy...good service...

Plus, it's walking distance from my house. If you're not nearby, no worries...parking isn't an issue here.
author: Jason N.

description:
Brilliant Pho, ewwy chewy imperial rolls, and an absolutely scrumptious roasted quail special. Kim Son is my most notable and delicious Vietnamese food experience in recent memory.

The restaurant is a cleaner, tastier version of some of my other Vietnamese connects in Little Saigon (I still love you Them Ky.) On a Saturday at lunchtime it was not crowded and service was blazingly fast and friendly.

It's too bad its way out in Tatooine, I mean, the Outer Richmond.
author: EDW L.

description: Ok so I have been back a few more times since my last review.  Food has definitely improved since then but I can not say that for the service.  Service was either slow or non-existent but hey if you want a tasty bowl of noodles and they have clear noodles (which is why they get the 4 stars) that's huge and a decent price...give this place a shot.  But for myself I find that the bowl of noodles is too big and I can barely finish half of it!
author: Allison T.

description:
Atmosphere:  Friendly, lively, home like atmosphere.  The owner who I never asked for the name even though I see him weekly is always friendly and always walk over to shake your hands.  He makes you feel at home, special, and loved.   

Food:  One of the best noodle house in the city.  I always get the rare steaks with meatball noodle soup.   His special platter is one of the best and can feed 3 people.   Ask him for it.  I think it is called the house special.   They also have great shrimp fried rice.    Another good dish to get is the bbq pork over rice.   It is delicious. 

I come back to this place once a week for the past 4 years and never got bored.
author: Tom L.

description: Maybe it's because I'm from socal. Maybe it's because I was raised in the heart of little Saigon on bolsa. I got the 7 item com tam (broken rice) and everything tasted bland. All the items were reheated or microwaved. My gf got the pho and there was no flavor! Would not go here again.
author: Jimmy N.

description: Very clean and spacious restaurant.  Service was fast and courteous.  The egg rolls were steamy hot and crunchy.  My Bun Reiu wa so so, good broth, but I really wish they had some real crab in there, I would be willing to pay more too.  my eating partner had a lunch special chicken clay pot rice, large portion and yummy gravy. If I lived close by, I would be there once a week!
author: Karen N.

description: I love this place. The owner and wait staff, who may or may not be family, are always super friendly and super quick which is kinda of good when your hungry. It's a clean, modest space with ample seating.  I've had the Pho, beef stew, spring rolls, 5 spice chicken and they were all done well....
author: Mike S.

description:
yum!!  vegetarian & asian? yes! pho w/ veggie broth? yes!!!

how rare is that?!


this place is great!  the waiters were patient with my complex orders and requests.  the food was delicious!  (I was being a fatty that day and ordered both the veggie pho and the chow fun w/ veggies.)   

(-) their bathrooms are TINY.  small than a regular public bathroom stall.  they need to do something about that!  and what's weird is that the sink is outside of the bathroom... like, where people wait in line to use the bathroom/by the kitchen... (i think)... a little weird.

probably my go-to pho place if I visit the bay again.  :)  just thinking about it makes my stomach growl. nom.
author: Melissa N.

description:
One of the few pho places in SF that is owned and cooked by real Vietnamese people so my Vietnamese parents actually like it versus the other pho places, which are usually a hybrid with Chinese style of food. 

We get take out from them at least every other week. I like that they are very friendly and always more than happy to accommodate any special requests you have.
author: Van C.

description:
Pho Kim Son is my destination spot for steak and tripe pho (my favorite Vietnamese snack food) in the Outer Richmond.  

The pho is good but they charge an extra $1 for steak on the side, which accounts for only 3 stars.  The dining area is open and inviting, although it can get noisy if there's a large crowd in the place.  They give you tea in a beer sized glass and give free refills. If you have to do to get someone's attention, all you have to do is raise a hand, because the service staff (which is mainly Chinese speaking BTW)  usually sits in a table in the rear corner of the dining room, when they aren't serving, and has no where to hide.  The only other dish I've tried there is the goi cuon appetizer (unfried spring rolls) that I order when I'm really hungry, which seem a little short on shrimp, but are otherwise ok.

A great place to stop for a cheap meal before (or after) watching a movie at the Balboa Theater to save money that would be otherwise spent on overpriced (and essentially bad for you) popcorn, candy and sodas.
author: Martin C.

description: Best pho I've ever had.  Took a while for our food to come out, but well worth it!  The broth was so flavorful that I didn't even add any extra seasonings (and I usually love extra seasonings).  Great BBQ pork too, and fresh spring rolls.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Courtney C.

description:
Came here on a cold friday night hoping to get warmed up with hot bowl of pho. I've been wanting to try out this place ever since I read Patra's review about 2 months ago...since this is so close to my house! My bf and I came here for dinner around 8:30pm - oops place closes at 9! But we were quickly greeted and seated and given menu's. 

Of course we ordered the #1...combination pho. I think its the same on every Vietnamese restaurant's menu! The pho was def. delicious..and came out in a pretty big bowl. Nice and hot esp on a cold night! Since I read Patra's review before, I knew that there was an option to make your own spring rolls. I ordered the one with the bbq pork balls since I can't have shrimp. YUM! I loved this. You get the rice paper wraps (which you dip into a bowl of hot water and can roll it yourself), rice noodles, and all the veggie fixing's for it. This was really fun to eat. 

Food came out really quickly too, and service here was super friendly. I believe it was the owner that came out and told us (since we were the last ones at the restaurant) to take our time and eat, and wasn't trying to rush us at all (even though they were closing). In fact, he brought out more veggie fixing's and hot water for the rice wraps for us! Best part - this place is CLEAN. Will def. come back here for the yummy food!
author: Betty S.

description:
I liked the Pho noodles here at Kim Son Vietnamese Restaurant. The broth was hearty without being heavy, and the meats and noodles were plentiful enough that I had to move them out of the way sometimes to slurp the broth. 

I am not a clay pot guy, so it is the soups and rice dishes for me. Service was very good. I will be back for more.
author: Sturm V.

description:
This is not a bad place to go for pho in Outer Richmond. The soup is good and the beef is thinly cut. But I normally eat pho in Chinatown so I'm pretty bias.

The prices are meh... about $1 more than places in Chinatown. I was okay with the prices but I was pretty disappointed with the amount of meat in the pho dac biet. 1 beef ball cut in half, about 2 thin pieces of tripe, five or six pieces of thinly sliced beef, and a couple of pieces of tendon.

The other thing that was really weird for my friends and I was the water. I swear they put bean sprouts in there to flavor it. It was weird....

Overall, this place is decent if you live in the area and you're craving pho. But if you're going out in the day and you're around Chinatown try Golden Star or Golden Flower - cheap, large servings, and great taste.
author: Lucy D.

description: Very delicious Phó. Only 3 stars though because of the MSG. It gave my husband a migraine all day. :/
author: Cassie B.

description:
Best Pho in the City hands down. If it's your first time eating Pho, I recommend ordering #4 - Pho Tai. Thin slices of cooked and rare beef with their famous vermicelli noodles. 

Favorite way to eat it:  Take your chopsticks and place the slices of beef at the bottom of the bowl under the noodles and let it simmer for a couple of minutes before eating.

Portions are large and the service is good.
author: blahblah h.

description: The pho is typical of any other pho place on the west coast.  There are a lot of choices on the menu, including free range chicken pho.  The imperial roles are generous in portion size.
author: Di Yin L.

description: Really, four stars? This place is so mediocre/bad. We got the spring rolls which had a texture that implied they were made last week. The beef pho was bland and the meat was of terrible quality. My husband got some orange chicken soup that he loved, but I think it was just because it was greasy. I tried it and thought it was gross. And I barely got a refill of my water when the check came. We'll never, ever go back, so everyone that was waiting in line has a little less competition.
author: Christine H.

description:
Thoroughly average in every way. I had the chicken pho and spring rolls. The broth was bland to average. I got takeout and it was lukewarm. Noodles and chicken were just so-so. Spring rolls were better- very fresh.

I have no idea why this place comes so highly praised. I checked out yelp before I went and was expecting excellent pho, considering the reviews and the fact that folks in SF know a thing or two about food. Here's my two cents: skip it.

On a positive note, the service was pleasant and efficient.
author: Johnny T.

description: My mom always orders take out from here and I'm glad she does. We just get the thit nuong and bun bo hue and they're both really good!
author: Diane L.

description: It was the end to an almost perfect day. dinner at Kim Son. I dont know what to say except 5 stars . Well, i  do have more to say actually. I immediatley  loved the menu , lots of veggie dishes  and lots of fresh fish. Plenty of healthy choices on the extensive menu. I enjoyed my glass of Chard with my Pho.Tthe jumbo shrimp were delicious too. the servings are large and you can feel content just ordering a bowl of soup. The atmosphere is clean, and pleasant , very relaxing on Sunday afternoon or evening. (or any day for that matter ) Nice service here too.  I just glanced at their card which i took with me and  they are open 7 days a week from 10am to 9pm. Long  hours, so you have no excuse not to give them a try. If you feel like venturing out , Balboa street has some great  places and is a wonderful little neighborhood . A Gem.
author: Donna S.

description:
We go here at least one time per week it is a great place for a fast dinner but with great food!

You don't leave with a craving for water like you do at alot of Vietnamese places in SF because they load the food with MSG!! this place is great do you self a favor and try it!
author: Mark H.

description:
Hands down the best veggie pho I've ever had. Kim Son offers a vegetarian broth which is pretty rare. It looks like a nice family owned and operated place. 

Unfortunately, it's in the Outer Richmond but definitely worth the trip out there.
author: kirti p.

description: Yum- fresh and light, and high quality food. A great find in this neighborhood of great food. Their rice dishes are tasty and their Pho too.
author: Gwenn G.

description: Strictly ok for a bowl of vermicelli noodles with veggie imperial rolls - maybe the pho is better. The imperial rolls tasted like they had been re-fried and in some parts, just burnt. Service was quick, staff was very friendly. plenty of locals though. unfortunately, I wouldn't be back in a hurry.
author: Shweta V.

description:
When I asked my co-worker, a woman in her 30's who's lived in San Francisco all of her life, what her favorite restaurant was in the city, she said, "Kim Son. The Pho is good, and the owners are really, really nice."

The next day, my friend calls me and tells me she's had a rough night - not only was she sick, but she had some guy drama to boot. I tell her, "Girl, we need to get you some pho" and we high-tailed it over to Kim Son.

The combination pho was very tasty, and the owner, a kindly Vietnamese man, was indeed kindly. 

When I'm in the mood for more pho, I'll head to Kim Son.
author: Jen O.

description:
i love this place. i wish i still lived closer.

Great vietnamese place in the outer richmond. Food is authentic and more plentiful than most of the other vietnamese places in the city. Great family owned place, with really nice people working here. Honestly, can't really go wrong with anything here.
author: Michael L.

description:
I have to deduct a star after branching out to other dishes here. I still stand by the assertion that they have the best pho in the city, but for anything else, not so much.

I am all about the combination clay pot. I just can't get enough of chinese sausage, shrimp, and chicken with rice that is baked onto the clay of the pot it is steamed in. But I don't get any of that baked on goodness here because they don't actually bake the dish in a clay pot; rather, they just dump the ingredients over steamed rice. Totally not a clay pot. I could deal with that, though. What I can't deal with it the consistent ignoring of my request for no ginger. What is it about "no ginger" that is difficult to understand? For the third time today, I opened my steaming ingredients over rice clay pot wannabe and bit right into a strand of, what else, GINGER! So then I had to go through and try to pick out every last strand of it. I'm so over it. 

Again, best pho you can find with great, friendly owners and employees, but being friendly clearly doesn't make you competent in taking food requests. For a good clay pot, go somewhere else.


Original review (12/08):

I  can't believe that I haven't written a review for this place yet! I could have sworn.....

The pho here is the best I've ever had. Period. I always order the same thing: BBQ pork pho, which is 2 meals. everything about this place is awesome. The owner is always super friendly (and even tought us a little Vietnamese once). When ordering take-out, they always give us hot tea while we wait. 

The pho broth is perfect, as is the balance of meat, sprouts, noodles, and herbs. I've tried pho in lots of places, but I will always keep coming back to Kim Son.
author: Amy B.

description:
I have lived around the corner from this spot for going on two years, and somehow I just never got around to trying the place. In the last month, I have gone several times, and I think I'm becoming a dedicated enthusiast. 

They make some seriously bitchin' Pho' here!!! I have been trying as many different kinds as a I can, and everything thus far, has not only been delicious, but the portions are GIGANTIC. They make great spring rolls as well. 

I haven't gotten into the main dishes yet, but I plan on trying as much as I can. 

On top of the great food, the service is always done with a smile, the girls working there are adorably cute and very helpful, and the older gentleman that I believe either owns it or manages the place is always very friendly. 

Great neighborhood spot, but for anyone trying to explore the city a bit, or maybe wanting some grub after a concert in GG Park or an outing at Ocean Beach, this would be a great spot to grab a bite.
author: Marco M.

description:
I moved into the neighborhood over two years ago.  On a whim my roommate and I decided we needed pho.  Some friends of hers had mentioned this place so we decided to try it and, two and a half years later, it's still our go-to for awesome pho.  I'm generally not a fan of ordering the same thing at a restaurant, but this place gets to be one of the exceptions.  The number six pho soup with beef and tendon is very satisfying, and with ample fixings of fresh bean sprouts, basil leaves, a healthy dip of Sriracha and hoisin sauce, you've got yourself a great soup.  

The restaurant itself is small and quaint and the wait staff are all courteous and efficient, always allowing a small group to sit anywhere you'd like.  I think I may have ordered a beer here long ago, but don't quote me - I usually go for some Thai iced tea to break up the salty goodness of my bowl of pho.  Great place
author: Lewis M.

description:
I love this place!

What I need to do is visit and write a review while basking in the glow of some delicious vegetarian fare... dishes loaded with noodles, mushrooms, and tofu... lots of tofu... maybe a pound of tofu? I didn't measure it out but it was tofu overload. The best part was--it was so good that I always end up eating everything off my plate. No leftovers, even if I get take-out. 

The food is fantastic, the folks running this place are wonderful, and the prices can't be beat. I remember stopping in for take-out once on an unusually cold SF day and they even sat me down with a cup of hot tea to drink while I waited.
author: alejandro p.

description:
ahhh...kim son.  i love you for being so close to my house.

i had the most insane craving for imperial rolls friday night.  i lost the takeout menu i had so i hopped on yelp to try and find what i wanted to eat...i ended up getting #32, nothing special, but i love my vermicelli, bbq pork & imperial rolls.  sometimes i like getting it with shrimp instead of pork - less fattening.  

take out in 5mins!  can't complain, not one bit.  they don't skimp on the fish sauce either.  i hate it when you get a tiny ass little plastic cup of fish sauce and you don't have enough for your food.  crunchy egg rolls, yummy pork, yummy noodles.

i've eaten in and gotten take out so many times i've lost count.  their pho is pretty good..the broth isn't anything too special.  personally, i never ordered #1, but i've had friends that have ordered it...holy crap if you can finish one of their #1, i bow down to you.  its enough for 2 meals for me!!

party in my tummy.   i want more.
author: Steph D.

description: conveniently close to my new house but parking over here is a #!$@& pretty good and decent vietnamese cuisine and located next to purple kow for some after dinner milk tea boba!
author: Linda L.

description: Really cheap Pho, and big portion. Decent.
author: Jason H.

description:
#32 - VERMICELLI WITH EGG ROLL N PORK
At first I thought the meat and egg roll tasted a little nasty... then I got used to it and actually liked it.  :)  Some jerky cooking my noodles didn't get his stir on enough so I had some clumps. :(

PHO WITH RARE BEEF
Soup was really good, noodles were bueno, and the meat was tasty.  I'm a fan. 

OVERALL
Wouldn't go out of my way to get some, but if I'm in the hood, it's a good option (though the Japanese place across the street is far more likely to get ma cash).
author: Dan M.

description:
pho is the best in a cold/breezy weather! :D

[when] monday, 08/10/09 @ 6:30PM. 
[what i got]  #3:  noodle soup w/ only beef steak
[price]   $6.45 +tax 
[service]  nice and friendly waitresses

all i can say is that this was pretty tasty and hit-the-spot!  the portion is generous b/c the bowl is HUGE.  i can wash my face in it. haha. j/k! 

it was even greater with all the veggies and sauces while drinking hot tea to digest the food. 

i will be back here again! :D
author: Deborah C.

description:
i really love this place. it's by my house, has good food, and get this-- it even has really good service!

when you get take out and order in the restaurant they always ask if you want water or tea while you're waiting. granted, it's just water or tea (doesn't cost much) but what other asian hole in the wall restaurant does this for you?? uhhhh... none!

the rice plates are great, the pho is pretty good, but i still have yet to try the build your own spring roll. it's part of the appetizer that costs about $18-$19 but you get a bunch of fixings to make your own spring roll. looks fun AND delicious, haha.
author: Kimberly F.

description: Fantastic pho and vermicelli dishes. This is my favorite pho in the city. Lines form for dinner so get there early or be ready to wait.
author: S Y.

description: Awesome pho, moderately priced,  fast service and very friendly staff . Right what I need after walking a couple of miles on the Lands End Trail.
author: Sujit N.

description: Best pho i've had ever.  The broth was the most flavorful that I have ever tasted.  For 7 bucks, they give you quite a lot of beef (I had the raw beef pho).  My friend's bbq pork was also delicious.  The best part of it all?  I didn't leave with a fatass headache, which means no MSG!!!  I can't wait to come back here.  Pho-king delicious...
author: Alex S.

description: This is my new go to spot, servers are usually very friendly and the food is the vietnamese comfort food i want every time . Definitely a hidden gem.
author: Tom K.

description:
Their fresh spring rolls are so-so. I got the shrimp and pork ones and they were unseasoned and plain. You'll find the vegetarian rolls to be much more flavorful. 
Also, why do the ladies sit in the back of the dining room shouting in conversation? It's a bit distracting.
author: Nigel F.

description: This place was nice. And that's pretty much about it... I wanted to check it out because of the positive reviews on Yelp, but my experience didn't live up to the hype. This isn't a bad restaurant or anything, it's just that I've had better. I ordered typical pork and fishcake pho, and the meat wasn't the freshest I've been served. The noodles were pretty good, but I don't qualify that as a redeeming quality haha. My friend got a seafood rice plate, and the portion didn't quite add up to the price. Overall, I would recommend trying out another Vietnamese restaurant and get more bang for your buck. :/
author: Teresa C.

description: Customer Service A+!!  Had Pho here for dinner with my Husband.  I'll definitely be coming back to try other dishes.
author: Susan M.

description:
I had to come here because of the rave reviews from my fellow yelpers.  I really liked it. It is a restaurant worth coming back.  You know what the great thing about yelp is?...................it forces you to try new restaurants.  So........here it goes.

They are one of few restaurants that actually have specialty rolls.  I usually have to request for bbq pork spring rolls at restaurants.  They have bbq pork rolls, bbq beef rolls, bbq chicken rolls.  I had the bbq pork rolls and they were huge.  This is the best Vietnamese restaurant owned by a Chinese guy. (hahahhaa)  Again.........I believe pho tan hoa on jones st in the tenderloin is still the best in San Francisco but this is as good as it gets in the Richmond district.

For lunch I had the number 2.  It was good, fast, and friendly.  I went in to get change for the meter.  I asked the owner........how much time do we need?  He replies........how many quarter do you have?  I have three.  he replies......that will be enough.  We placed our orders and boom within 7 minutes we had all of our food.  After we ate...............went to check the meter.............we had 3 minutes left.  He is good.  Going to have to come back to try the other items.
author: jason g.

description: The pho tai was bomb, and the servings were huge! The broth was so good and the meat was super soft! And it was a pretty darn good price for $7! They just gave you a lot of herbs and onions on top of the pho, I would recommend asking them to not add them if you dislike the herbs and onions! It was tough to pick them all out.
author: Julie N.

description:
Still good.  No complaints.  I had both the combination pho and their bun thit nuong after a nice day at Ocean Beach.

You get service with a smile and zero attitude.  I like that.
author: Justin C.

description:
What a cheap and quick way to get you filled up before going to Balboa theatre. 

So, I went here with my bf and his sister before watching a movie. Apparently, his sis never been to a vietnamese restaurant and she really loves food. So, we all ordered the less adventurous Pho - chicken noodle. We also had a round of fresh spring rolls - love 'em! 

First, the fresh spring rolls arrive. I carefully guide a roll onto my chopsticks dip the tender roll in the oyster sauce mixed with hot sauce and dig my teeth deep into a complete bite...yum. I'm focusing on my spring rolls, when I notice my bf's sis trying to get her spring roll on her chopstick. She picks it up, it falls, she picks it up, it falls, she picks it up, it falls, she picks it up, it falls. Finally she mutters "what the hell? forget it" and picks it up with her finger. I casually keep munching away trying not to giggle.

The soup arrives. Now, my bf's sister is so fun to eat with because she provides sound effects like a cartoon character. First, she sees how big the bowls are and she says "Oh wow, that's huge!" She grabs a spoon and takes a sip..."slurp..MMM...Oh...this is good. MMM. MMMM. slurp..MMM...oh...ooh...MMM.oh..oooh...mmm." Yes, that's exactly how I feel, too, about the soup.
author: Liz K.

description:
I like this place. Good food, very nice people running the place. However, I have the nagging feeling the portions are getting smaller, and the prices are going up.

Kinda like a Hershey Bar.
author: John H.

description:
Pretty big restaurant and its actually quite nice to grab a window seat before sunset and just enjoy your dinner with the sun setting into the ocean.

We ordered the spring rolls, which had shrimp and shredded pork. This was done quite nicely and the shrimp was small and dinky like how some places do.

My lady had the vermicelli with beef. Came in a large bowl and was done quite nicely. Beef was a bit chewy for her tastes but I thought otherwise. 

I just had the porkchop with shredded pork and egg over rice. Also came in a large portion. Pork chop was nice, a bit overdone but good none the less. The egg was also quite tastey.

Service was nice and quick and towards the end of the meal they also gave us two slices of melon~ yay
author: phillip w.

description:
Kim Son, how I want to rate you higher. 

Every time I go to a Pho place I get the same thing. I think it stems back to my childhood. When I lived in Hong Kong I ate things that scared me. Everyone else seemed to be enjoying these strange things with fat and bones and blood (oh my!!) but I was not getting into it at all! Maybe I am too white, because even though I consider myself to be an adventurous eater, there are some things that are just not good to me in Asian cuisine. So, when my Vietnamese friend wanted me to have the "real" Pho experience some years back and ordered me something that had all of these elements, I had flashbacks and was not okay! Since then I always order the Pho with rare beef....its safe, and I like it. 

Because of this I am easily able to compare the same dish at different restaurants. The Pho here is not bad at all. I would say it was okay before the change of ownership but has improved greatly since then. The service, on the other hand, is the worst ever!!!  We had our order taken, got our soup, and never saw a worker again until we yelled to the back for our bill...and there were NO OTHER CUSTOMERS AT THE TIME. If I could have the service of the old place (read.....you actually get some level of service) and the improved food quality of the new owners I would return more often.
author: Drue C.

description:
Great Pho, won ton, imperial rollls, BBQ pork and 5 spice chicken. 
It's a great go to place in the neighborhood. They have really good ice tea too.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Homey vietnamese food, service with a genuine smile(I think it's family-owned). Good place to dine alone, in peace. Menu has a ton of offerings. I had the BBQ shrimp and BBQ pork rice plate- perfect portions, delish! Belly's happy, warm and full. Will be back for more.
author: Vicky P.

description:
I'm a little conflicted about this experience.  

On the one hand, it was just the right size, just the right amount of noodle and HUGE quivering slices of tendon.  I'm talking about thick, gelatinous, offensive chunks that were not overcooked and retained that perfect chewiness.  5 huge stars.

On the other hand, there was a $1 extra charge for tai on the side, the broth was not mind-altering, and the imperial rolls were lacking (though it made up for it in quantity).  My lunch cost $16 including tax.  That's a lot of money for vietnamese food.  A lot of money.  Some places, I could get nearly 3 meals out of that much money.  3 stars.  

Vietnamese food prices are on the rise.  This is not the go-to place for pho.  There's a dirty, little place in the TL that sits in the dark, cold recesses of my heart.  The Asian women at the next table got this lovely looking plate of imperial rolls, BBQ pork, tons of lettuce leaf and more, which looked delicious.  It's just not for me.
author: Christina C.

description: This place is awesome!   Great Vietnamese food.   Very friendly staff.   Not so great atmosphere, but hey, it's not a fancy restaurant.
author: Steven H.

description:
Pretty good Pho!! its Pho what else can you expect! People were nice, and it was perfect for my hang over! 

Inexpensive and there egg rolls are pretty good as well.  

I would come back!
author: Freddy S.

description:
WHAT...THE...MEHHHHH

La cucarachas es muy cute (guapo?)....Just not on my plate!

The food here is mediocre.  I USED to eat here cause it was convenient whenever I was hanging out at the buddy's pad down the street.

That was until I found the cockroach taking a siesta under my pork chop!  MY PORK CHOP IS NOT A BED FOR SLEEPING!!!!! =(

So....needless to say, I will NOT be coming here anymore.

If you do...be sure to look for any unwanted surprises under your pork chops.
author: Curt L.

description:
Pho' Kim Son Restaurant is a neat little spot for some good food at a decent price. 

The barbecue chicken is flavorful. I had the combination special at $7.95. I got soup, with my plate and a choice of either barbecue chicken, pork or beef. A few small shrimp were included as was a spring roll and a salad. 

Atmosphere is friendly, clean and service is fast. If you bring in your ticket stub from the Balboa Theater which is a few steps away, the owners will give you a 10 percent discount off your total meal. 

So, it is a value deal and worth a try. 

Street parking available right outside. But Balboa Street is very busy and parking not easy to get. 

Master Card and Visa accepted. Take some time to walk around Balboa Street. Lots of neighborhood charm. MUNI #31 bus runs up & down along Balboa Street. 

Easy connections to Park Presidio Blvd and 25th Ave.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
I never thought it was possible to find a good Vietnamese restaurant in the Outer Richmond, but wrong I was. I really, really like Kim Son! Their prices are decent, service is good, and the wait staff is friendly.

I highly recommend the #32 - bun thit nuong cha gio (aka vermicelli with bbq pork and egg rolls). The pork is cut perfectly and radiates with flavor. The eggs rolls are crispy but not too greasy. The vegetables in this dish are very fresh. My pet peeve with a lot of bun dishes is when there are too many vegetables, which can easily overpower the rest of the dish. Fortunately this is not the case at Kim Son because there are just enough vegetables to complement the succulent pork and tasty egg rolls. The nuoc mam (fish sauce) is made to perfection and not spicy, something not easily found in other Vietnamese restaurants. Mmmm...as I'm typing this, I'm salivating like one of Pavlov's dogs.
author: Christine T.

description:
I drive across town every week to buy two orders of the vegetarian cold rolls plus whatever I feel like - last time -- tofu and veggies chow fun -- yummy and enough for four or five meals. I could live on these cold rolls -- they have tons of cooked veggies with a yummy soyish sauce.  So good...and the other stuff is pretty good, too.

Five stars for the rolls only.
author: Melissa G.

description:
This is my neighborhood Pho Joint.  And for me Pho is a very important meal so thank goodness for a pretty good pho place close to home.  I mean I also have Americana up the street, which gives more noodles and may be more filling but to me, the broth has got to be good and 9 times out ot 10, Kim Son does it for me.   

But thanks Kim Son for giving me one of the essentials of life.  A Good Pho Joint close to home.  I definitely need that in my life!
author: Mark W.

description: I don't know why i've never been here before but their food is fantastic!  Friendly and helpful staff and the food tastes great!  I had the bun rieu which i've always wanted to try.  Tasty, flavorful, although i was still looking for some crab bits.  We also had the Banh Hoi Thit Tom Nuong, which is a plate of bbq pork and shrimp, rice noodles, lettuce, mint, etc.  all the fixings to make do it yourself spring roll.  Love love love that they use the thinnest noodles for this.  The meat is flavorful and tender and shredded carrots etc all marinated.  On our second visit, 3 of us decided to just get that and an app to fill us up.  Great portions sizes and you really are getting a good value.
author: Susan Z.

description: i only tried the chicken curry noodle soup. it was really flavorful and huge chunks of chicken which was great. but the biggest turn off about the dish was the immense globs of oil in the soup. it did give it some flavor but i wish it was less oily.
author: Stella J.

description:
Kim Son really hit the spot with their BBQ Shrimp and BBQ Pork Rice dish.  It filled me up and made me curious about thier noodles.

So, I was pretty pumped to go back and try Kim Son's Pho.  I ordered their #1 Pho Special.  You know the one with the tendons, tripe, beef ball, sliced beef, etc!!

The broth was ok.  I killed the meat.  The highlight was the tendons which was extra gelatinous and the beef ball which had a mild smokey flavor.  But the broth was plain.

That was sort of a downer.  But the food is above average and they bring out the food quickstyle.  So, if you got the hunger pains and around the area.  Hit up Kim Son.
author: Sam T.

description:
This is my favorite pho place in the city.  I like that it's close to my house, but don't worry, I'm not giving it extra stars based on that (it's not like they located themselves nearby for my satisfaction!).  They have an extensive pho menu, and they serve tripe and tendon in their pho.  Some people think it's gross.  I think it's authentic.  And delicious.

Unlike other Vietnamese restaurants, however, their food is just as good as their pho (which can't be said for some places, like Tu Lan, where the food is great but the pho is nothing to write home about).  So on the rarest of occasions when I'm not in the mood for pho, I know I have other viable options.

Service is also very friendly here.  I've walked in 10 minutes before closing, and they were quick to welcome me and give me any seat I wanted.  No stinkeye.  

They take card.  And the food is cheap and effective.  That's all I can ask for.
author: Dwigt S.

description:
good all the way around.

great food.   portions and price match well.  portions are huge.  very fresh and tasty.  service is quick and friendly.
author: Peter K.

description:
I love this place. My boyfriend and I go here about once a week, before (or sometimes after) a pool game or two at Hockey Haven across the street. 

The only reason I leave out one star here is because their spring rolls aren't all that consistant. But onto better things:

The service is great - it's a family-owned restaurant and it gets packed, but the owner (I believe his name is Steve) is gracious and kind, always greets us by name with a smile on his face. All the servers here are sweet and quick - if it's crowded, be patient and have some tea, they're trying their best. 

The Food:

The Kung Pao Chicken is SUPERB. I tend to have a fear of chicken - namely, chicken parts I can't easily identify. Their chicken is amazing. It's high quality meat, mostly white, very tender and juicy and cooked to perfection. 

The Spring Rolls vary from golden and crispy to somewhat stale and tough to chew. Most of the time they're great - wrap them in a lettuce leaf and enjoy the pickled carrots (fresh) on the side. Yummmm.

The beef here is quite good too - tender and juicy. The vegetables in all the dishes are crunchy and farmers-market fresh. Bright colored dishes are always a good sign (well, as long as the bright colors are natural...)

The decor: The lighting is bright - but to me, it's bright in a cheerful way, rather than "Am-I-in-a-laundromat-or-restaurant" way. The pictures on the walls add color and the place is spotless. You could eat off the bathroom floor. It's charming and cute.

Great place, great people, great hood. :-)
author: Robin G.

description:
My San Francisco Pho search is officially over!

#3 Pho Tai is all I need.
author: Michael R.

description:
Love Kim Son!!  The staff is friendly the food is great.

I almost always order the BBQ pork Pho, the best I have had.  Every now and again I get an egg roll also great.

My wife gets some of the plates they offer, something new ever-time and has liked them all. 

good prices great food what more can you ask for
author: Ryan S.

description:
Dang:  How culla forgot about reviewing this wonder GEM 

First, my favrit:  the bbq beef "BUN", that's over dry softened rice vermicelli.

-and, after that, everything mostly, is delicious and bountiful.

Family-friendly, meaning also, they very very reasonably priced.

Mebbe I go THERE instead?
author: Clifford L.

description: This is the best pho place I've found in sf so far.  The imperial rolls are also very good.  The staff is very nice and the service is fast.
author: Ren A.

description: The large bowl of pho (#1 on the menu) had a nice amount of beef, beef balls, and tripe along with the soup and noodles. It's not really too heavy either as I've had greasy pho in the past. The wait service was ok. They refilled water, but I would've been waiting for awhile if I didn't flag down a waiter for the check.
author: Gerard Y.

description: I miss, miss, miss the chicken curry soup. Next cold rainy day, if there's the slightest excuse to go to SF, I'll jump in the car and get over there.
author: Alana D.

description:
3.5 stars, I round up. =D

Good little place in the Richmond. My friends and I arrived at roughly 8:00pm yesterday, Saturday night for some dinner. The place was pretty full. We were able to snag the last round table in back for a party of seven. I come here every now and then, but first review on yelp.

I ordered their dinner special which consisted of: soup of the day, "salad," imperial roll, and entree. I had the the BBQ beef entree. Overall the food is good - nice BBQ taste to the beef with the soft (not mushy) rice. The Imperial roll was also good; however, I noticed their lunch special, which is the same layout, you get a larger eggroll. I only notice this because the eggroll is actually good.

Overall, I was satisfied. I wish the portions were slightly bigger for dinner. They forgot the eggrolls that came with our dishes, so we had to tell them, but they brought it right out and apologized and gave us some more napkins.
author: Tim S.

description: The pho was really good and so were the Imperial Rolls. I branched out and tried the Bun Bo Hue. Not too bad.
author: Shawn B.

description:
Today, I went to Kim Son for the second time.  Like before, the pho was generously-sized and tasted pretty decent.  The broth was definitely passable, but it could have had more flavor ... the pepper, lemon, basil, sprouts and sauces helped enrich it some, but good pho broth should be rich on its own.

The service at this restaurant seems to be lacking whether it's a packed house or you're the only one in it.  Service is most definitely friendly.  It's just very lax.  If you're lucky, the young girl will be your server ... she's very enthusiastic and eager.  The adults don't really seem to give a darn.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I get my hair cut down the street and was killing some time before my appointment.  I love Pho and never seem to find a decent place in SF that hasn't  cheated on the ingredients and only put 3 types of beef in the soup.  The soup was flavorful and if you're thinking about getting the Large bowl, you better be hungry.  

The waiter was very nice and the place was clean.  I'm sure I'll be heading back there when the weather gets colder and I'm craving some decent Pho.
author: Twist' D.

description: Ordered the 5 spice chicken. It was a bit too salty and it wasn't what I was expected  on how it would taste either but I guess it wasn't too bad. The service was crappy as well. They didn't even give me the correct change back!!!!
author: Christina L.

description:
I usually come here once a week and order #30 - the BBQ Pork and Prawns over rice. Totally incredible. Everything else I've had is also awesome. 

They also have the most amazing hot sauce in the world. It's not so much hot as it is full of amazing flavor. 

They have plenty of seating for large groups and have extremely fast and friendly service.
author: Justin B.

description: The pho is passable -- the bun rieu is the main attraction here.
author: Guillermo K.

description: I hadn't noticed this place before and don't know why.  I came here one late afternoon on my own and ordered the won ton soup and the bbq pork rice plate with an imperial roll.  The soup was delicious,  I especially appreciate places where the soup broth is clean, non greasy, and not salty.  The bbq pork was good also, also not too salty.  The imperial roll seemed over fried though.  I'd definitely like to be back to try everything else.
author: Emy B.

description: I came here w/ my sister, her boyf and my boyf a few weeks ago. It was a cold night so I opted for a nice bowl of pho w/ beef and brisket. Boyf and I shared a side of spring rolls, but I was too full to eat it. We brought it back to my house, but I didn't get a chance to try them so I don't know if they were any good. My pho was good though. The waiter was attentive and got us everything we needed in a timely manner (ice water, napkins, boxes, and the check).
author: Justine O.

description:
Meh, This place is okay.. I would only come here if I wanted something To-Go. It's as good as any other Vietnamese place you go to in outer Richmond. 

Oh yea, it seems like they use too much MSG for the base...

Why? Because it's less than a block away and there's nothing else. I'm not saying this place is nasty, but good enough to be acceptable...
author: William C.

description:
Our favorite Vietnamese restaurant PERIOD.  So glad we live close by. Best chicken pho and the tastiest bun rieu (crab noodle soup)!!!  We come here at least 1-2 times a week.  

YAY for Kim Son!
author: Annie N John L.

description: Came in on a saturday afternoon and the place was packed, we got one of the last tables and i have to say it was busy... I had the number #6 vietnamese pho rare beef w/ tendon..my friend had the #5 just rare beef..The broil was tasty and the beef and tendon we good, they do give alot of noodles but i didn't mine...All and all a good noodle house i'll be back to try the rice plates... Oh i almost forgot the thai iced tea i also ordered was good not to sweet and had a great tea flavor...
author: jonathan h.

description:
This is the BEST Lemongrass Tofu Entree and Veggie Fried Roll Appetizer I've ever had from a Vietnamese Restaurant.  EVER!!!

There take out is fast and they are very efficient if you eat at the restaurant too.

Very friendly.

All was amazing!
author: Sabrina A.

description:
YO HO HO and a BOWL o' PHO!

Actually that doesn't quite rhyme, because I'm told 'pho' is actually pronounced more like 'fuh' with a little inflection.  So why isn't it spelled 'fuh,' you ask?  It's simple, my friends:  who would want to sit down to a steaming hot bowl of FUH?  NO ONE!  FUHGETABOUTIT!

So 'pho' it is, the classic SE Asian rice noodle soup that is fast becoming ubiquitous.  Alas, good pho seems hard to find, and after dining at Kim Son I regret to say I will have to keep looking.

Mind you, it's not bad, and it looked like Kim Son had a wide array of interesting Vietnamese dishes to try, but if you're looking for the best pho in SF, move on.

My pho was served with the traditional tasty accompaniments of lemon wedges, thai basil, sliced hot pepper, and bean sprouts.  So far so good.  I ordered Pho Tai Nam (pho with sliced eye of round beef and flank steak), which is only slightly more adventurous than the ultra-banal (not that that's a bad thing) Pho Tai (pho with sliced eye of round beef).

The bowl was jam-packed with a heaping wad of rice noodles, so no one can accuse Kim Son of skimping.  Or can they?  I poked around looking for my meat, but I could only find a couple slices of each kind.  So I rationed it out, wolfing down mouthfuls of noodles with a few nibbles of meat slathered in delicious Sriracha (the red sweet spicy sauce).  Just as I was winding down and filling up, I swirled the broth with my chopsticks and--lo and behold!--a treasure trove of meat was malingering on the bottom of my bowl.  Chagrined, I stuffed in as much as I could, but by then it was too late.

Perhaps the most crucial pho component is the broth, and this is where Kim Son did not impress.  It just wasn't tasty or savory.  I like a broth that is rich and complex, with lots of cilantro, onion, and so on, and this wasn't it.

On the up side, the Thai iced tea was appropriately served, with strong home-brewed tea on the bottom of a fountain glass with a generous portion of sweet condensed milk on top, just waiting for your swirling pleasure.  Sometimes it's premixed and poured right out of a bottle, and that's no good at all.

Oh--the SERVICE!  How can I forget the service?  This was the most, uh, memorable part.  I went at 7:30 on Friday night, and the little place was rockin'.  Nary an empty table, with people waiting at the door.  The poor staff (I'm guessing extended family) just wasn't up to the challenge.  It took a long time to get a menu, a long time to get served, and a long time to get my check.  They were curteous and apologetic, which was appreciated, but swift service would be better.
author: John D.

description: Love coming here for there pho! Trying their fish claypot today hopefully it's just as good yuuummm
author: Yennie N.

description: My go-to Vietnamese restaurant now that I am a parent.  I used to frequent PPQ all the time but that changed once I had kids.  PPQ is cramped but Kim Son is spacious and kid friendly.  Every time we go, they give our kids (ages 2 and 3) their own plastic utensils, bowl and cup.  I love their BBQ pork and imperial roll over rice and their five spice chicken over rice dishes.  I usually order those since my kids like to eat it.  The spring rolls are also good.  Can't really say much about the soup noodle dishes since I usually don't order those but the few times I did have them, they were good too.
author: Christina H.

description:
Can't really remember much about this place. i've only been here once since it's pretty far away from where i live and from where i work. but i remember that the pho and the broth for the soup base was pretty good and above average when compared to these sunset pho restaurants. the portions are pretty decent and large. Service is pretty good. 

i think i'll visit again when i'm in the area and i'll give this place a better review
author: Eric Y.

description: i usually can't finish a bowl of bun rieu but after coming here for lunch with my sister, i did!!!! it was sooooooo good. i recommend their bun rieu here. yummy!
author: Valerie N.

description:
The pho was hot and good but only giving me 1 beef ball when it's a combination order was really sad. It's like the kid that got picked last, the unwanted chip dust at the end of my snack bag....

Service was brisk and hopping on a Friday night, and my god how can you screw up imperial rolls? But apparently when you don't put meat in it, you can. And overfrying is never a good thing.
