But otherwise the 7 ingredient rice wrap rolls you make yourself was really good. The vegetables were fresh and clean. Love the sugar cane shrimp.

Let me tell you, I started dessert first and worked my way back to an appetizer...3 bean colored coconut milk ice drinks is a must for any vietnamese restaurant....drool.

The pho bowls were really big and even if it says small. It's hella big!  I had to split my bowl with Angela T. cause I can't finish it otherwise.  Thank god for still hungry relatives.

Parking is always fun, it's like musical chairs but with dire consequences when you don't find a spot.  Tough on a Friday and Sat night. But doable if you hit after 7:30 ish.
author: Pauline L.

description:
Pretty authentic Vietnamese food at a reasonable price. 

Things to try:

Vietnamese salad with shrimp: Freshly cut shrimps, assorted greens & pickled turnip strips, sweet lotus roots, everything topped with a sprinkle of peanuts and fried garlic.

Bun Bo Xao: Beef with Vermicelli Noodles with a mixture of greens. Pretty decent.

Canh Chua: Kind of a Vietnamese type of sweet & sour soup.Yummy! Various types of veggies, tomatoes, pineappes, & catfish! :D

Waitresses are superb. The owner was really nice too. He's always polite and talkative with customers. He's also very welcoming. Food comes out really fast. The setting is very welcoming and comfortable. Go try! :D
author: Janice M.

description:
Came here tonight with one of my buddies tonight for a quick dinner.  We went in with 2 empty stomachs and walked out with 2 bathroom stories.

Since this was my first time here, I ordered the #23, Bun Bo Hue $6.95, to gauge this restaurant's worthiness.  My friend decided to do the same, plus #49, Cha gio $5.95.

The food was pretty fresh and satisfying overall and the service was adequate, but it didn't include pork blood like My Canh (on Broadway) and my bowl was full of what I affectionately call "the clear things" (tendons).  I hate that stuff.  Plus I did not like the imperial rolls as much as Golden Flower's (on Jackson Street).  These folks didn't even cut the rolls in half.  zzzzz  No VIP service for me tonight. I can imagine someone with poor chopstick skills trying to break one of these very crispy rolls in half.  Bam! It goes flying off the table.  On the upside, I'm not nearly as thirsty as I usually am after downing a phat bowl of pho.  So either these guys do not use MSG, or other pho places use alot of MSG, ...or both?  :P

After we finish eating, my friend tells me about how he couldn't immediately find the light switch in the restroom.  He figures, oh, this must have one of those clapper things.  So he claps his hands several times to find that the lights still do not come on and he's looking more and more like a fool. HAHAHA  He turns around to notice the switch behind him near the door knob.  HAHAHAHA  (see my pic)  As for my story, hmm... Let's just say, it's a good idea to wash your hands thoroughly before using the toilet (if you are a male) if you like to break up the jalapeno peppers into your soup with your hands as I do.  :P

Pretty decent place overall.  I may go back.
author: Tom Y.

description: Neighborhood Pho place that serves up a big bowl of Pho.  I am concern about their MSG quotient.
author: Jim J.

description: I come here allot with my boyfriend. We live in the area. My first choice is Pho 2000. We come here like 3 times a week sometime. I can eat Pho everyday. This place is good and the owner is also very very nice. Service is great.
author: Ge I.

description:
1/1/2008 (this time I took pictures):
What better way to cure a hangover??? Something warm, something filling...

Thus, I brought my friends here the morning after ringing in the New Year with bottles of champagne and roaming the Pier...and they all enjoyed it for the most part. Again, we were seated quickly, and the food arrived in no time.

My friend ordered the #24 Crab Paste & Tomato sauce with rice noodle soup...I took a bite and it was enough to convince me to come back in no time. 

'Tis was a good first meal for the first day of 2008. 
_______________________
12/13/07
OMG! How come I never knew this place existed? I've lived in the Richmond area for a couple of years now, and even work near by at the VA on Clement and 42nd, but have never paid attention to the restaurants on this end of Balboa Street. 

Today, midway through a long, tiresome lab work meeting, our wonderful boss took us out to lunch.  And honestly, this was THE thing I was looking forward to the entire week at work.  My boss was swearing that this place has the best Vietnamese noodles...and you'd better believe him because this man sure has a tongue for good (and not to mention, spicy) food.  We were seated immediately, served hot tea, and the waitress took our orders.  The food came quickly, and they gave us a big plate of sprouts, basil leaves, and limes for 6 hungry people.  Everyone, except for me, ordered noodle soup.  And for the first time ever that I've seen, they bring the cooked meat and shrimp out to you on a side plate, instead of it already in the soup.  After your big bowl of noodle arrives you drench the meat in, add the sprouts/lime/basil and all the other goodies.   Being the person-who-always-regret-what-she-orders, I felt kinda lonely being the only one who got the B.B.Q beef over rice.  Don't get me wrong, I liked it and it was a huge portion, but I was secretly envying my coworkers slurping away at their noodle soup and saying "this is soooo gooood!!" 

The food was great and cheap, service was fast...we were in and out within an hour and had to return to work to finish our lab meeting...with major food coma.  

I'll definitely come back here again!!
author: Lisa C.

description:
After I got sucked into a "where to find good pho" thread - I decided to yelp out about my favorite spot for soup in the city. It's kinda out of the way (38th and Balboa) but it's hands down the best pho I've had in San Francisco and I'm gonna tell you why:

First and foremost, there's the super fresh, quality ingredients.  The broth is VERY clear, which means less fatty oils for me to eat. 

The setting inside is quaint, but not run down, like the typical Vietnamese restaurants in the "Little Saigon" quarter of the city. Plants are abundant, as are the clean and uncluttered floors, tables, etc.

Also, the business is family run, and they're a nice happy older bunch. They take pride in the food they serve and they make it obvious.

If I could give this place more stars, I would.
author: The Shmooze ..

description:
Mammoth size phos! It's huge! Gigantic Titanic sized bowls. And they're fast too.

Here's the scenario, I'm hungry and it's ten minutes before the movie starts. I go in, order a #1. The hugest bowl of pho comes out in a few minutes. I was so stoked and excited at the same time! Ever see food and think, that's it? 

That wasn't the case here. No siree. I saw the pho and was literally scared. Good thing my friend was there to help me out. She also had a 3 bean drink that was delicious.

We spent about twenty minutes here and a few minutes of the missed start of the movie. But, boy was that a fast meal. It was well worth it. Next time I'm here, I want to try their stir fried noodles. Another patron ordered it and it looked damn good!
author: Lester L.

description:
Best Pho place to cure a hangover! Truth!

I have come here on a handful of occasions to cure my early Sunday morning hangover. And guess what, once i get up and leave the restaurant...i'm cured! 

I always get the #1 which is traditionally the Pho with everything in it, and to be quite honest with you it tastes like ever other #1 i've had throughout my life. But i'm not giving the restaurant stars based on its food, which i've heard from my relatives that get different things on the menu is actually pretty good. 

I'm giving the place stars based on reliability, the food never changes what i expect. The same everytime, and i love it. Service, the staff is friendly always smiling always giving me more water. Price, yeah pretty much dirt cheap. Cleanliness, you know how people say that the best Pho is in a real dirty place, well Kim Son is a hybrid of dirty and really clean, so i'd have to say medium status for cleanliness. But the food is as good as a real dirty place. 

If you are a true Pho connoisseur like i am, everything i just said above makes sense.

I APPROVE!
author: Eric T.

description:
I like this place a lot, so much that I used to come here every week. Their bun (vermicelli noodle dish) is so good and boy are the generous with their noodles and beef. i've also tried their pho and rice dishes that are just as good.

I would say bye to the staffers every week to make sure they'd remember me. One day, I struck gold when they gave me free soup and sliced fruit. I freakin' earned that appetizer and dessert that day for coming to Kim Son for months!
author: Jane C.

description:
walk to pho. that's instant happy for me. the people are nice, the location is close to home, and the pho is not bad.

i don't know if i'd drive far to visit this exact place, but good pho is few and far between in sf for some reason.
author: Ameer N.

description:
My favorite thing about Kim Son: all the great NON Pho food! The crispy noodles are AMAZING and chock full of different meats and veggies - including fish cakes! Yum! The menu is quite extensive (though I was saddened by the loss of the black bean clams) and the portions are HUGE.

As for the Pho, I admit I do not have a history of enjoying the dish. I usually can't even stand the scent of Pho restaurants. I am glad to have found a place that serves Pho my partner likes and other dishes I like. But, even better, I actually kinda liked the Pho here. Not LOVE, but it definitely was not as sour and pungent as other varieties. Not sure what this means to Pho fans, but it's a plus for me.

Also, people at this restaurant are just HAPPY, the servers and the patrons. It makes for a relaxed, enjoyable setting for a meal. Combine this with the proximity to the Balboa theater, I have a feeling we may be coming here quite a lot.
author: Veronica L.

description:
I always get the Vermicelli dish with Imperial rolls and beef #32...it's not on the menu; but you can always substitute what you like. It's always fresh and affordable! You always see locals in there, bring their whole family! They have these great round tables that can seat 8-10. It's very casual, friendly and pretty clean compared to other Vietnamese places--you actually see them wipe down each table with disinfectant! 
Their Pho is pretty good too, it will make you feel better after a hangover! That's how I discovered this place...I was sooO hungry and wanted something warm and wholesome in my belly! One of the owners, could tell I was not in good shape as soon as I walked in...they quickly seated me and offered me hot tea. 
Great for dinner before you see a movie at the Balboa Theatre! One of the hidden gems on the Balboa strip!
author: Clarice A.

description:
Smiley service every time I go.
I love food that isn't too heavy.  So, Vietnamese is a plus for me, especially Pho.  But, don't go for here the Pho....a bit too light.  Go for their rice dishes, instead!! All are just right - tasty and fresh.  The service is always quick and friendly.  

P.S. They accept credit cards for $10+.  There's a B of A and United Commercial  Bank down the street, though.
author: Mellie P.

description:
Returned for lunch today. Giving it a second try....

The food is okay. I ordered combination Pho, and it was very okay, too. I have tested better pho. The utensils were kind of dirty and oily. Yikes! So I had to wipe them off with my napkin before I used it. And this place got 96 for cleanliness???

The place really didn't win me over. The price is good though for what they have, so when there is nothing else to eat for lunch, I guess this place is okay to go.
author: Daisy S.

description:
Their imperial rolls are the best ones in the City. They are crispy, fresh and flavorful. I could eat them for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It's comfort food to me. I am already craving them again by typing up this review. 

Their other dishes are great too. I enjoyed the beef stew and combo plate with five spice chicken, shrimp and 1 imperial roll and rice. 

The family that is running this restaurant is very nice and welcoming.
author: MS K.

description:
I recently moved to the city from back east and had only eaten at a few Vietnamese restaurants.  Naturally loving peanut sauce, pho, bun, and spring rolls, I immediately began to scour the city trying to find my Vietnamese joint. 

From Financial District to the Outer Richmond I ate, ate, and ate at many a Vietnamese Restaurant.  Soon I learned the importance of many Vietnamese essentials, like quality of noodles, consistency of peanut sauce, quality/quantity of vegetables, and quality of meat.  I found some restaurants to be good, and others okay. Then I found Kim Son.

Kim Son taught me what a great Vietnamese restaurant really was. Their noodles are the perfect combo of thickness and moisture.  The sauce is excellent and the chicken is so tender and fresh, it makes my mouth water just thinking of it.  Tons and tons of veggies! The Pho is great as well. Oh yea! The leomanade too! 

The two owners of the Restaurant are very nice sweet people. 

Great on price and never a problem to find parking! 

Don't be discourage by the long drive! Come check it out!
author: Peter G.

description:
This place used to be my family's favorite restaurant where their specialty is Canh Chua Tom soup (hot & sour soup made with tamarind juice), catfish in a claypot, and stir fried clams with basil. Those are tough dishes to find that is cooked right. It wasn't the typical pho restaurants that is a dime a dozen. It was one of the few that serves authentic family style dishes. We started coming here more than 10 years ago. The place wasn't the cleanest, the dishes are always chipped but the food was damn good and cheap.

A few years ago we heard there was a change in owner and we noticed the change in taste and quality. Tonight, this place is meh. Saving grace is the soup is still good but not to die for. The catfish is ok but definitely tone down in flavor and is no longer spicy. The clams is a bit fishy and on the bland side. Tamarind shrimp seasoning is good but the shrimp tasted like it's far from fresh. They served us a salt & pepper crab that is cold...like refridgerator cold in the middle. I can go on and on but you get the picture. The pho soup bowls are ginormous but the soup tasted only ok.
author: Yenly M.

description: I just came back for lunch today after couples away SF. The foods changed, my used to be favorite pho is tastes differently now. the taste is weird. REMEMBER: D NOT  TIP HERE! The waitresses told me once I tried to give 30% tip. I was told that the restaurant OWNER WILL ROB ALL TIPS HERE. DO NOT TIP AT THIS RESTAURANT!
author: Best R.

description: I have been eating here since I was 8 or 9...went there because the Sugar Bowl closed a few doors down.  Have been hooked ever since, and even when the owners changed the food remains....excellent...I drive all the way across the city to eat here, the number 13 is great or the combination plate...my two favorites...Keep the good food coming...The service and people are friendly and the price is right...
author: Ryan A.

description: We ordered take-out from here unsure about what to expect. The pho was amazing! We ordered the chicken and veggie pho. The veggie pho was to die for-full of tofu, broccoli, carrots, two different kinds of mushrooms, and an incredible veggie broth! It is definitely the best veggie pho I have had in San Francisco. Delish!
author: Katie M.

description: this is for vegetarian pho!! kim son does it right, seriously they don't skimp on the veggies and tofu, the vegetarian broth has flavor and it's a great balance! Also, the fresh veggie rolls are great too! Please keep this on your menu as most veggie pho places aren't flavorful! also love the friendly service and clean space! will come back :)
author: sue c.

description:
Trying to decide which place near the Balboa Theater to eat dinner before a show, and Kim Son looked the most promising, with many more diners than the other places on the block. We were really happy with our dinner. We ordered the fresh rolls with shrimp and pork, I had the chicken with lemongrass and chili, and Dean had the vermicelli with shrimp and pork. (he apparently wanted a lot of shrimp and pork)

Our waiter, who must have been the owner, was so friendly and welcoming, and didn't look frightened to see us come through the door. Sometimes I feel like an invader when I go into a restaurant where I am the only white patron, and I am worried that I will order what all the other white women order - the chicken and broth with veggies, right? I was not nervous after being greeted by such a friendly person.

I mentioned that we would not be able to linger as we were going to a 9:20 showing. The waiter was very kind to deliver our check in time for us to make the movie. When does that ever happen? I usually get heartburn knowing how late we're going to be. Boy I'm nervous.

Why not 5 stars? Well, the ambiance is only so-so, with pretty bright lights, and ambiance means a lot to me. If you are in the hood, check it out. And go to a movie at the Balboa, dammit.
author: Samantha C.

description: This is a wonderful place to eat. They make the soup stocks from scratch and all the food is fresh and delicious. My favorites include the rice plates, the fresh rolls with BBQ pork and shrimp, and of course, the Pho. A visit to Kim Son is not complete without trying the tangy, sweet lemonade. yum!
author: Jay H.

description: This spot truly lives up to its 4 star rep! I think without Yelp I would have never checked it out because when you get there you sure will be immediately turned off by its super cheesy low grade outside decor and its very plain inside decor, typical of your super cheap dirty Chinese spot. However, the mom and pop will welcome you with unusual friendliness into their "house" and serve what will turn out to be one of the best Vietnamese experiences in SF! Very good salads and bún ch giò, but what will get you is the ph, it's really delicious without being too salty, served in a huge portion without being too heavy. It's now 1am and I wish it were open now!!!
author: Paolo D.

description:
A bowl bigger than my head means this was gigantic.  $28.00 for the entire meal which included imperial rolls, a Spicy Beef Soup, and a Combination which has everything from beef tendon, beef, all the way to tripe.  The total cost including tip was $28.00  Not bad.

The service was friendly, even if it was a bit of a fake smile.  The prices have gone up with the new year about a dollar, but whatever.  The soup base was flavorful and they had all the veggies!  Yippee for southern style viet.  Add some hoysin sauce, cock sauce (it has a picture of a rooster), and your straight.  

Definitely a place I would hit up again.
author: Po L.

description: You should really come here for their Pho.... all their other stuff is meh. So why the 4 stars? Because every goddamn Pho place in the city serves deceivingly retarded non-authentic crap. This place is the closest you can get to the Westminster and San Jose Stuff.
author: Anthony N.

description: cheap eat of the authentic Vietnamese food.  Very nice service and clean.  Great food for its price.   Definitely recommend to try out when u are in the area and want to taste the authentic Vietnamese style cuisine.
author: tomcat f.

description: OK, whatever - their food is great so we're back to five. Had the best imperial roll here I've had anywhere (better tonight than previously - maybe just part of a good batch or whatever). Rice plates are better here than elsewhere, and the chicken salad is one of the top two (ties for City Restaurant in SJ for me). And their broth is great in the pho.
author: Jen D.

description:
I ate here with a friend on a Saturday night. It was very easy to get a table and the service was very quick. 

The mixed vegetables with tofu was delicious -- great flavor! I don't recommend the vegetable chow fun -- it was slimy and the lacked any real flavor.
author: Janel A.

description: Good spring rolls, Thai tea and Beef Stew. Good chè ba maù. Parking sucks and we had to pay for street parking even on presidents day. Boo SF!!
author: Auzzy B.

description:
A quaint restaurant where everyone is very attentive and friendly. I always appreciate places where the staff genuinely enjoy their jobs, and I have always been greeted and served with a smile. I am in there all the time and they definitely remember their regulars.
The pho portions are perfect and at a reasonable price.
I have only ever had the pho but they have an extensive menu that I'm sure is amazing.
Try it out, you won't be disappointed!
author: Coralea L.

description: After a night of drinking, Kim Son's pho always calms my tummy. This place is clean and the service is pretty good. It's close to home and has plenty of street parking. My boyfriend and I were being picking one time when we ordered the 3 color drink, we only 2 of the 3 color. They fulfilled our order without attitude!
author: Sabrina K.

description:
This is one of my go-to places for pho.  Even though it's out of my way, I can't help but come back here to get my fix of pho.  Portions and prices are great, no complaints.

The spring rolls are the freshest I've ever tried, by far.  Their bbq beef/chicken over cold noodles also rocks.

Overall, one of my absolute pho places around :)
author: B F.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat, good thing is right down the street from my house. One of the best mom & pop's in the neighborhood as well. Lunch menu is really good & dinner specials are yummy, so give them a try if you are ever in the Richmond.
author: Issy V.

description: The only thing I really know about MSG is that restaurants spend a lot of money advertising that they don't use it.  Several reviews mention that Kim Son uses MSG.  I had pho there last week and wanted to go back for more every day since.  I'm wondering if the people that say that you shouldn't use MSG are the same people that say you shouldn't use drugs.
author: P J.

description: we spotted this place after walking out of the dumpling king down the street. and am real glad we found it cause the pho here was deeelish. had the super crispy imperial rolls which are tops. the pho was pretty amazing. i loved how clear the broth was. noodles al dente, meat was just thick enough.  its a 5 star pho spot for sure, but im only giving it 4 cause of the portions are on the small size. have to give a mention to the service being excellent as well. most certainly will be coming back when i feel like visiting the more foggy side of town.
author: Marcus S.

description:
Yay!!! I've discovered ANOTHER vietnamese restaurant that serves scrumptious vegetarian pho.

Yummy...plenty greens and all kinds of mushrooms. Just keep in mind that, for some odd reason, it doesn't come with the plate of bean sprouts. You have to request for it.

Love it!
author: S M.

description:
good food, good service, low low price.

Yummy in my tummy. Eggrolls were awesome, it was with the chewy skin.
author: merritt t.

description: This place has one of the best bun bo hues in the city. The broth is very tasty....I havent been here enough to write a longer review, but I will def. recommend it. It's never crowded, which is a plus!
author: annie w.

description:
in short, this is the saltiest pho i've ever had in my life.  i ordered the #1 and was pretty much blown away by how salty the broth was.  on the plus side, there was a lot of meat and goodies in the bowl (which itself is rather large).  

oh and the laminated menus were pretty disgusting.  i know, i know... it's a pho place but still. no one likes a thick coating of grime on their menu.  right?
author: Scott K.

description: I really like this place a lot...their raw sliced beef and fried egg rolls for appetizers are awesome.  I also really enjoy the pho and it is great that I do not have to drive all the way to the tenderloin to get it.  Other than that, the food is pretty typical of any of the other Vietnamese restaurants.  Service is also quick and friendly.  I will definitely be back.
author: A W.

description: So I recently moved from OC, where they have THE BEST Vietnamese food. I already had one bad experience with pho in the Inner Sunset at Perilla so I was looking for something better. My friend lives in the Richmond, we were cold, starving and hungover. So after walking along Balboa looking at EVERY menu in the window for vegan pho, I decided to eat at Kim Son. Both of my friends weren't Vietnamese so they didn't know the difference between good and bad pho. I went in with not so high expectations though. Turns out they had a few vegan options! One of my friends ordered beef pho but didn't realize it was raw beef. So he didn't like it much and after eating it said he would have rather had a vegan bowl of pho as well. I ordered one vegan pho and one bun cha gio chay (eggrolls with noodles and salad) for my friend and I to split. He was overwhelmed at the portion size so I ate way more than half of it all but I didn't mind because it was delicious. Haven't had a chance to come back yet but I definitely will soon.
author: Justine L.

description: I LOOOOVE this place. I always get the #12 BBQ chicken Pho. It comes in a big bowl and I even though it takes like heaven, I can never eat the whole thing. The owner is also
author: Michelle H.

description: Ok. So I get worried when my appetizer (Imperial Rolls) are waiting behind me (literally 60 seconds after we ordered) They were cold and chewy, lacked any flavor and tasted like they were sitting out all day. Then I ordered the "free ranged" chicken Pho. (Oh, how I looked forward to that scrumptious stew on a cold foggy SF Day). Again arriving a little too soon for my comfort, about 2 minutes after the appetizer arriving. So my first question was "WHERES THE CHICKEN?" Oh there it is all nice and shredded..... Take my chopstick full of chicken and I chew, and chew, and chew, and chew and chew and chew.................... So chewy I spit it out. Ok, lets try again..... Chew and chew and chew.... I GIVE UP!!!! I picked out all the chicken and put it on a side plate, the waitress and owner never came around. Until the bill was due, I had to scream across the restaurant and get up for a simple glass of water. IDK what people are thinking? This place does not deserve the 4 stars it has. I gave it a one star because the soup was at least hot, noodles were half decent, the place appeared clean however i didnt do my GR inspection, and my friend seemed to really like her dish.
author: Cindy T.

description: Love the chicken or pork bun with imperial roll and the Vietnamese iced coffee. The pho is good too. Inexpensive, good food and wait staff.
author: Nancy K.

description:
i love the fact that i have a great pho place so close to home.  its perfect, i walk down eat a fat bowl of pho then walk home and don't feel gluttonous.  their spring roles are great too.  their rare beef and tendon is the best, then next in rank would be the fresh range chicken pho.
this place definitely gets 5 stars for food, service, and location!
author: junie k.

description: This place is pretty good man.  I was studying at Zephyr (across the street) the other day and I was hungry, so I ate here with one of my friends.  I had the beef pho with the beef on the side.  The raw beef was garnished with green and white onion.  I love marinating the beef before i cook it in my soup.  The interior of this restaurant is very clean and the pho did not disappoint as well!  I usually eat pho at Loi's on Irving, but I wasn't in the area.  This pho is pretty good and I think I might drive over here to eat one day.  Yum Yum Yum
author: Lauren Y.

description: kim son pho is our go to place when we don't know what we want for dinner and they're right around the corner!! They're always delicious and fresh and I have yet to complain about anything! And the price is super cheap so there really isn't anything to b*tch and moan about! Plus after eating a gallon of pho, we can walk it off by walking home!
author: Julie H.

description: Pho here is pretty good and so is the service :] Really nice and friendly people that work here. I came here once during lunch time with my friends since it is near my school. The food is more filling than another pho places I've been to
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
i've tried bun rieu all over SF and this is my favorite place.

for around $8, you get a large hearty bowl full of tomato, crab paste, shrimp, tofu, and an abundance of noodles.

DELICIOUS and perfect for cold winter months.
author: Wendell M.

description: This was the second worst bowl of pho I have eaten on the city.  The worst is Mai's Vietnamese on Clement.  The soup had no flavor.  It tasted like water.  My skinny friends with no taste buds likes to come here.  The servers and owners are nice though.  Too bad the pho = no good.
author: Fatty A.

description: They are so friendly in there. It's a little vietnamese restaurant 3 blocks from us, and thank goodness they make good food. Of all the food places on that Balboa strip, Kim Son is one that my husband and I can agree on as worthy of our regular visits. They're quick, consistent with the yumminess, clean, and also super sweet to our son.
author: Jill F.

description: It's Pho time @ Kim Son!  This was my 3rd time here and it still taste the same as my 1st.  Good place for a quick bite with friends or family.  The place is not a hole in the wall like some other Viet. restaurants.  They do have bigger tables that can seat 8-10 ppl.  The specials (look on the wall) rice plates are good choices, but the pho is one of their hot sellers.  Order #1 and you'll be slurping on noodles for awhile --that bowl is humongous unlike other pho joints I've been too.  Service is great.  3.5 stars for me.  This is a place for pho-holics.
author: Eric Y.

description: This is one of my favorite places to get pho in the city, next to PPQ.  The soup is tasty and the beef is fresh and cut the perfect thickness.  Service is also great and fast.  I like that when I go with my coworkers, the lady boss gives us Canh Cua on the house because we work nearby and frequent the place a lot.  They also have really good salt and pepper prawns and a yummy curry chicken dish.  Actually, I like everything that I've tried on their menu so far.  Only complaint is that their Ca Kho is a little on the salty side but nothing a big bowl of rice won't fix.
author: Katelynn L.

description: Mmmmm. Pho coma everytime. Back this meal up with a serious dose of caffeine or be ready for a nap. Only knock on it is the location. Close to me (which is great) but far from everything else. God I wish they were open late.
author: Chris J.

description: My family's favorite Vietnamese restaurant of all time. Granted the service is not the best, but it never was - even in the hands of the old owners (Not counting Eric and Linda who were fantastic and who I miss dearly!) Kim Son has great food at a great price. If you want a REAL Vietnamese meal, order the special appetizer (Dat biet, I believe). You get egg rolls, bbq pork strips, shrimp wrapped around sugar cane, plate of veggies, and rice paper wraps. You wrap your own rolls. YUM. SO YUM. That's my usual order if I can convince another person in the group to share with me since it's way too large for one person. But yes, beware of the poor service. The new owner tries his best to give good service so if he's there, he'll pay lots of attention to the customers, but the other servers don't seem to care much.
author: Angela T.

description: I'm so glad this place has $6.95 lunch specials, even though that isn't necessarily cheap. But come on, it tastes a lot better than the pre-packaged crap I've eaten. Anyway, the special came with salad, barbecued pork chops, rice, soup and baked egg. I also tried their 3 bean drink, which tasted very interesting. The service was a bit slow, and I actually was about to walk out because they didn't get to me when I first came in. I'll forgive them just because I live nearby and it's really the only Vietnamese place around.
author: Alex Y.

description:
this place is amazing. great food. i love the five spice bbq pork special.

the pho is delicious, the service is good, the place is super clean. my favorite vietnamese place in the city.
author: Casey W.

description: Maybe my favorite Bun place anywhere!  + Perfect Pho
author: Mark W.

description: Pho is pretty good &the service is pretty good. Friendly workers as well. When I went last time since I go to school at Washington which isn't far from Kim Son, and it was time to pay, they didn't want to accept my tip because they said I'm young &I shouldn't waste money by just tipping them, they're really generous, but I felt bad. Everytime I were to give the tips, they would just tell me to take it back so then I'd have to just leave the tip when they're not looking &then just say thanks &walk out.
author: Lisa T.

description: After living in Southern California for many years and sampling all of Orange County's Pho offerings in Little Saigon, Kim Son was a welcome change.  We had an excellent chicken Pho with fresh spring rolls.  The food was great, the service was friendly and I really recommend the place.
author: Eric O.

description: loved it and that's all i can say. The athmosphere is calm and the place is super clean
author: tammy z.

description:
I have stayed away from Vietnamese, I just did not find it to my liking.
About two years ago I started going to Vietnamese restaurants because others wanted to.
I found that I liked PHO, but I did not like some of the things they put in it.
Then I went to Kim Son, what a great place.
I tell them exactly what I want in the PHO, and they get it perfect every time.
Now I go in and they just do it without me even saying anything, I just say PHO and there they go.
So one day the waiter said why don't you try the special.
I was concerned at first, but I did.
It was 5 spice pork with a salad, rice, soup, and an egg roll.
You can also get chicken or beef, but I went for the pork, it was great.
I could not believe what I had been missing.
The flavors were well rounded a little spicy, a little sweet,little savory, everything you could want.
I still go for the PHO most of the time, but that special gets me now and then.
Its always on the menu at 7.95 its a great deal.
The people there are vary nice.
The place is vary clean.
I took my Vietnamese friend there, he said the PHO was vary good, and hes picky about PHO.
author: Aaron K.

description:
It was a little of out the way for me but the easy parking (that should be criteria here in SF) and the huge proportions of the soup made the extra drive worth it.  

I ordered the regular combo beef pho.  As mentioned, portions were generous and the quality of the meet was good.  The condiments (basil, brussel sprouts) were fresh.  Overall, good pho soup place.
author: joel b.

description: Living in the Outer Richmond, I always welcome the opportunity to try a newly discovered restaurant hoping that it's good enough for me to not have to take MUNI to eat that cuisine. This is the case with Kim Son. I went here on a rainy afternoon with my girlfriend, and we were both craving imperial rolls. We both ordered the rice, BBQ pork and imperial roll special to go, and we got it within 10 minutes. After taking it back to my house and opened the container, it smelled like I found my spot. The imperial rolls were delicious; perfect morsels of deep-fried goodness. I also enjoyed the BBQ Pork, although it was a little greasy and the oil got into the rice. I would definitely come back here, and I heard their pho is great too.
author: Theo T.

description: Since they changed owners, the prices are higher but the food is the same. It's pretty good. Not my fave pho place, but it'll do.
author: Jessica O.

description:
the noodles were still hard after
i left them in the soup for the whole time i was there
so all i did was eat the meat
=X
author: Kathy K.

description: One of my favorite things about the Richmond, is Kim Son's!  Right next to the theater and the best rolls in their Bun's.  Most vietnamese places make(or buy) the very tiny and hard imperial rolls but Kim Son's are large and filled with flavor.  The staff is always very attentive and friendly.  The only downside is that their soups are very salty tasting and that sometimes detracts from the great flavors in their food.
author: Cass C.

description: I pretty much only eat the pho here, the chicken or the bbq chicken. It's not due to any failing on the part of the other dishes -- all the port plates are good -- it's just that the pho is that good: excellent broth, vibrant sides (especially the basil and the peppers), and superb chicken. The chicken in the pho ga is steamed before being dropped in, and it gets that perfect stringy texture as it falls apart, matching the noodles. The bbq, which I just had last night, blew me away; they must marinate that sucker for 24 hours.
author: OuterLands X.

description: This place indeed serves really good authentic Vietnamese food.  I love their rice plate (broken rice) so much.  The service is not too good like those expensive restaurant but you get what you paid for.  I care for the food quality so I don't mind.  Parking is a little challenging.
author: Lily K.

description:
this is actually my favorite pho place in san francisco. the flavor of the broth is the best i've had in the city. i'm a snob about pho bc i was raised in san jose where pho was basically invented ;) well.... not really but you know what i mean if you've been to essj (east side!), there's a pho restaurant around every other corner and sometimes even twice in one corner! mmm ..how i miss it.

so having been relocated to sf, this is my pho place of choice. it comes closest to home for me.

excellent and near-boiling broth, fresh ingredients, great menu, and awesome selection of vegetable sides and condiments.

plus, how cute is the lady that seems to be running the place? the service is wonderful here.

love it love it love it!
author: Amanda N.

description: I've only been here once, but it's the best pho experience I've ever had.  I'd def be here everyday if I lived just a little closer.  The staff is extremely friendly and the pho was amazing.  Polishing off my large bowl was therapeutic, though I must say I was hurting bad afterwards.  I'm dying to come back here and try some other menu items.  If you like pho or if you're a pho snob try this place and see what you think.
author: Nate W.

description: I like this place, no complaints at all.  The waitresses and waiters are nice people and the food is good and good priced.  The pho is delicious and their rice plates are also good.  I however did not really like the combo clay pot I ordered once, it was very generous, but I did not like the taste of it.  I would stick to pho and normal rice dishes, but you may want to give the clay pot a try considering it may be worth it if you like the taste.
author: John L.

description: Yummieiei, love the imperial rolls altho its sOOOooo.. bad for you.  Not bad for being a pho place around the outer richmond.  Love curing my hangovers there with a nice bowl of pho.  Service could be better, but then again, i'm not paying an arm and a leg for the food so its all good!
author: Syonora A.

description: The Pho here is FANTASTIC! You get a lot of it for a very decent price.  Service is great and the food comes very fast.  I recommend the Free Range Chicken Pho and the BBQ Pork Pho.  Their BBQ pork fresh (not fried) spring rolls are also wonderful.
author: Natalie S.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat in my neighborhood. I've really never had a bad meal here. I'm a big fan of the lemongrass tofu in particular, but the pho and various grilled meat dishes and rice plates I've tried have also been excellent. There are probably better Vietnamese places in town-- there are so many to choose from-- but this is conveniently located next to a movie theater, the prices are good and the food is tasty. What's not to love?
author: Sara G.

description: By far the best Vietnamese restaurant in San Francisco.  Well, I haven't tried ALL of them, but of the probably 10 or more I have tried, this is the best.  Great, fast and super-friendly service and the freshest ingredients!  Also, their peanut sauce is really delicious - perfect consistency (not syrupy) and delicious!
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and dine here frequently. The food is pretty good - yes, there are better Vietnamese restaurants in town. I often enjoy the BBQ pork and eggroll over Vermicelli, as well as the pho. The seafood soups are also good.

The food arrives in no time. The restuarant was remodeled a few years ago and appears to be clean, if unexciting. The service staff is usually aloof and sometimes it seems like a bother for them to get up from their food preparation and actually take your order. I don't take it personally.

Overall, it's a good value.
author: Jarvis M.

description:
Good food. Nothing really to complain about. Good service. 

The house crispy noodles is stellar!
author: Alex K.

description: this place is good, bu they raised the prices. I like the owners of this place because they get to know you and they are always consistently providing quick and easy pho. you should go here right before a movie at the balboa theater
author: Katherine F.

description:
Another good place in SF to get Vietnamese noodle PHO besides Pho Hoa in Tenderloin and Pho Phu Quoc in Sunset.  If you are the type to freak out for your life when entering the Tenderloin, you should come to this nice, quiet neighborhood near ocean beach to enjoy a good bowl of pho when it's freezing cold outside.  Other food on their menu are also good.  

Although, minus one star for price and annoying service.  The restaurant was really clean and nicely decorated, with good customer service.  But I got annoyed when they wanted to clear every bowl/plate the second I put down my chopsticks assuming I was done.  With their fingers on my bowl, I couldn't say "no i'm intending to get a few more bites, then having to repeat the incident again when i put down my chopsticks to chat with my friend."  Otherwise, they're all good.
author: Karen C.

description:
A neighborhood pho house and more...

I eat here regularly - about once a week.  The service is quick and friendly and the food is good.  I used to get the same old same old at every Vietnamese restaurant - pho with rare beef but decided to be more adventurous at Kim Son.  The Imperial rolls here are excellent - they're crispy, hot and not at all greasy - the oil is hot enough!  So many places fail in not having the oil hot enough, making the rolls very greasy and arrive in a pool of oil atop some lettuce.

I've also had the steak salad which is ok, just but be sure to share it with someone, it's huge.  The seafood on crispy noodles is yummy as is the seafood chow fun and the seafood pho...hmm I guess I like the seafood.  The shrimp in clay pot is delicious but skip the catfish in clay pot - too much work in picking out the bones.  

Tony loves the sugar cane shrimp with vermicelli.  Cameron orders the BBQ pork chop combo EVERY time he eats there.  It's really a great deal because you get soup, a generous portion of pork chops, rice, salad with a shrimp and an Imperial roll, all for $7 - hard to beat.
James has tried both of the fried fish and likes both but prefers the one with the ginger sauce.  

Try it - you might like it!
author: April F.

description: My favorite pho noodle place in the Richmond. I haven't tried anything else here, but broth is very clean and light, the vegetables are fresh and their BBQ pork is good. The place looks a little bit like a dive, but nonetheless its clean inside, not too expensive, and definitely not trendy.
author: Anton L.

description: ahhh kim son...this is a family favorite. we love this restaurant. not only is the food delicious but they have warm friendly customer service. we've always had a great experience at this restaurant!! their imperial rolls are the best!
author: caroline g.

description: This review is for the PHO only. One word---Tasty!!! Second in SF only to Golden Star in Chinatown. The broth is aged to perfection with a wonderful depth of flavor and the accompanying plate of sprouts, basil, peppers and citrus is always fresh and crisp. The shrimp spring rolls with peanut dipping sauce are pretty darn fine too. The service is friendly,  the restaurant clean, the serving size is huge and the price is el cheapo. A bit of a ride to the Outer Richmond, but well worth it especially  since the beach and the park are right there too. If you are a Pho fan, pick a foggy day and head on out.
author: b g.

description: I swear, every single Vietnamese restaurant I've frequented in the past couple of months is like a sauna with the steamy windows.  You would think that everyone eating breaths a collective hot breath and exhales.  Anywhoo, I went here last weekend with a good friend to catch up and eat soup.  However, I was totally distracted by a version of the #52 at Kim Son (please see my review for Thanh Tam II).  Kim Son's version was a bit larger.  The imperial roll was rather hefty but not as flavorful as Thanh Tam II's).  The pricing was comparable, not competitive.  So, if you are on Balboa, this place is pretty darn good (especially on servings).  Minus half a star for the uber slippery floors on a rainy day and another half of a star off for circling the block 20 times before getting a parking space.  Minus one whole star for the older waitress who allowed herself to be exploited by a group of white folks who asked her to hold a sign that said, "Happy Birthday Cynthia"!  Sorry, I had to say it.  For the most part, it's a decent place to kotch and have some Pho (pronounced FA as in fa-la-la-la) and or Thanh Tam II's version of #52.
author: Dorothy S.

description: I go there often with friends for lunch.  Their various kinds of noodles are really nice and the portions are large.  The service is very nice and food is tasty.
author: Miinno N.

description: A wide selection of Pho's available, which is what I've gotten every time.  Yummy and lots of it.  Leftovers for lunch, yay!  Nothing bad to say about the service or food.  A great local neighborhood place we'll visit often.
author: Shauna C.

description: This is the best pho in the world! Kim Son is right next to the Balboa Theatre, so if it's cold and foggy (or raining) after your movie, slip through the steamy, brothy doors and the nicest family in the world will warm you to your marrows. Their vegetarian spring rolls are incredible, with crunchy tofu and mushrooms...delicious! And you can't go wrong with the pho. I've had the house beef pho, the free range chicken (could raise the dead) and the barbecued pork (slap your momma good). They are all so good, they'll make you cry. Seriously, I had cravings for Kim Son even before I was pregnant.
author: Sarah Y.

description: I wish this place was around when I lived in the outer richmond district.  Their combination beef pho is very good.  Portions are pretty hearty.  Very good service and very toddler friendly.  Place is very clean.  Will return to try other items on the menu.
author: Aileen D.

description: This is the closest to the real thing in SF. I come from san jose so I had high standards to be met for the pho here. This is the closest you're going to get other than going down into the tenderloin. If you're looking for a good place to eat near the beach, and very fair priced.
author: LINH B.

description: Got takeout there for the first time tonight. Had the vegetable pho. The broth was well above average, and everything else was really good. They cooked their tofu right, and had a variety of tasty, well cooked mushrooms in the mix. Definitely going back.
author: Chris S.

description: sooo yummy especially if you get take out.. super cheap and one bowl of pho is enough to feed two people I can never even finish half of it..
author: Kathleen P.

description: I just moved into the neighborhood and was thrilled to see a place nearby serving one of my favorite dishes - pho.  Big dissapointment.  The broth was super greasy and the restaurant itself gives off a vibe of uncleanliness which some of the other reviewers have commented on.  The table felt oily as did the utensils.  And I can well believe what someone else said about witnessing a staff member not washing up after using the restroom or finding a cockroach.  There's no way that this place is staffed by people who truly care about being clean.  Yuck.
author: Missy L.

description: It was a cold and rainy day and we needed a lunch before attending the excellent Cartier exhibit at the Legion of Honor. We found Kim Son on Yelp...and it lived up to it up to its 4 star reputation. It is in a nondescript strip of storefronts on Balboa. It is as uninviting as it gets from the outside and the decor is....well...nondescript. On the positive side, there were mostly Vietnamese patrons when we arrived on a Sunday at 1pm. We ordered simply; an order of Spring Rolls with BBQ pork and Pho - an order of the tomato-crab paste and an order of the BBQ Pork and shrimp (#13 and 24 respectively if I remember correctly. Both of the Pho dishes were excellent, although very different. The BBQ pork is superb - do not miss it. The Spring Roll was a revelation. I have never understood what they were all about. These Spring Rolls were delicious. The whole meal, including a beer was very affordable. We will be back! You will not be disappointed.
author: RJ T.

description: wow! thats  all i have to say, the soup came out and i felt like i was drinking a bowl of salt! i took one bite and asked for the check. horrible just horrible
author: Barry S.
